name: Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder
about: What it is:An award-winning, texture reducing, coverage boosting, blurring balm, that absorbs sweat and balances oil all day while maintaining hydration..Coverage:Light.Finish:Matte.Formulation:Cream.Highlighted Ingredients:- Upsalite: Balances and absorbs excess sebum and sweat while maintaining skin’s hydration..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:This award-winning, balm-to-powder formula is powered by Swedish super ingredient, Upsalite. Its technology absorbs sweat and absorbs oil throughout the day for a natural, soft-matte finish. This petal-like texture feels like a balm but sets like a powder for a long lasting, shine-free look..Clinical Results:In a clinical study consisting of 31 women, studies indicated statistically significant improvements for pore appearance, texture, fine lines, and wrinkles:
ingredients: Magnesium Carbonate, Isohexadecane, C13-15 Alkane, Isododecane, Dimethicone, Squalane, Synthetic Wax, Synthetic Candelilla Wax, Kaolin, Tocopheryl Acetate, Linum Usitatissimum (Linseed) Seed Oil, Zingiber Officinale (Ginger) Root Oil, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Glyceryl Behenate, Limnanthes Alba (Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Microcrystalline Wax/Cera Microcristallina/Cire Microcrystalline, Polyethylene, Stearoxy Dimethicone, May Contain/ Peut Contenir (+/-): Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891),  Iron Oxides (Ci 77491, Ci 77492, Ci 77499), Yellow 5 (Ci 19140).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-To prime: Using universal or a tinted shade, tap and blend with fingers to prime eyelids or complexion..-To highlight and contour: Using a tinted shade at least two shades lighter or deeper than your skin tone, apply with fingers or a brush to brighten and sculpt. .-To set foundation: Using universal or a tinted shade, tap on with fingers or a dense brush to set complexion.  .-To add sheer coverage: Using a tinted shade, press and roll in an even layer into textured or oily areas..-To set and add coverage: Using a tinted shade, press and roll through the t-zone and tap to build additional coverage where needed. .-Note: As you wear it throughout the day, this unique formula adjusts its oil absorption to address your skin’s specific needs..-Danessa’s pro tip: For light coverage apply with a fluffy brush or your fingers. For full coverage use a dense brush or sponge.

OVERALL, deffffff get this product if you have oily skin!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: I swear, this product was made for me.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, gray hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm over 50 with intensely combination skin. My cheeks are dry like tissue paper, but my t zone is so oily that nearly every foundation separates or oxidizes on me.  This product is my new holy grail. it gives me enough coverage to even me out, doesn't look cakey on my dry areas, and keeps my oily areas totally matte all day.  I don't know what kind of magic Danessa puts in this little tin, but it's what I've been waiting for all of my life. it's excellent for low makeup days as well as full glam days.  It's got a lot of pigment, so use it sparingly until you get the hang of it.  I will buy this product for as long as they make it. total game changer.

I wouldn’t use it Anna a foundation on its own, but it’s light enough to wear under for sure!

If I’m going out for a long time, I either use the water serum primer with it or the universal as a primer and my face acts like oil is not something it knows. Sometimes I use the shade 10 as a kind of primer with a favourite foundation like the nars soft matte or haus labs and it’s beautiful. Danessa gives tips for the different skin types and how to use these products which is so great. I’ve hit pan and have stocked up because its a must in my routine

reviews.review_text: one of my favorite products! nothing can replace the blurring balm powder in my routine. it is so easy to use, the undertone matches me perfectly and great for my oily combination skin. i tell all my friends about this foundation.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: if you’re an oily skin girly, you NEED this in your routine. i don’t even write reviews like that, but i just want to shout this out from the rooftops. no primer product or setting spray has ever come close to this one at controlling shine that i almost think it’s witchcraft (it’s not, it’s just the magical upsalite ingredient). i get oily within the first HOUR of make up application (see my first pic of me in white) but with this product, my skin was PAPER DRY to the touch after 8 hours (see pic of me in brown). this is with NO touchups. i used to have to mop my oil away and i actually cannot believe i can take photos with flash now and not look like a disco ball. i use the translucent one as a primer under makeup. my preferred method is using a stipling brush to apply but i always apply with my fingers on the go as well. actually a dream. thank you danessa <3 forever repurchase and im so happy to finally have a product that works for me.

reviews.review_text: I agree with the witchcraft sentiment. My oily T-zone will obliterate most primer, foundation, powder combo in a matter of an hour or two to the extent the formula starts to break up, but this keeps my face intact and mostly matte thro if h a full workday. Super weird as it seems greasy on application but what can I say it works!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_title: MAGIC for large pores and oily skin!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product is like nothing I’ve ever tried before. It makes large pores disappear and stays matte on my oily t zone all day (almost too matte honestly) even without setting powder. When blended with a brush, I get a separated/pilled look but when I use spatula to apply to my face then blend with a beauty blender it looks flawless. It also feels like you aren’t even wearing makeup (I usually hate feeling foundation on my skin). I rated this 4 stars because of the limited shade range (not sure I’ve found my perfect color match yet) but this formula is pretty amazing for oily girls.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Great skin tint for everyday use. I barely get oily with it and easy to use. Not great for dry skin but great for combo to oily

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brunette hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Someone else's review asked what kind of witchcraft this product was and I have to agree, every time I use it I think what kind of sorcery or magic makes this stuff work?? I kept hearing about it and when Sephora had it as a reward, I figured why not (fully expecting it to make my face a greasy mess). I have a very oily t-zone, it's literally the bane of my existence, but this product makes me blurred & pore free all day. I don't use foundation, so I can't say how it works with that. I do my normal morning skincare, put this on in my t-zone area, and layer primer on top (right now Benefit Porefessional). Then I do a light dusting of setting powder & spray. Voila, blurred to perfection all day long!

reviews.review_title: What in the witchcraft is this??
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I waited to review this product because it’s so different than anything else I tried before and I wasn’t sure how I felt about it. It looks and goes on like Vaseline, which is basically the last thing I’d ever think to put on my extremely oily face. I hated how it felt and looked — greasy. I nearly washed it off. But I didn’t and I set my timer for 5 minutes, which is always the length of time I want to allow a primer to set. After five minutes, still didn’t look great, but it wasn’t quite as greasy. If anything, I couldn’t even see it. I did my eye makeup, brows, lip gloss. This all took about 10 minutes… and then somehow, magically, the primer was set and my skin looked amazing. Hands down, amazing. Couldn’t see my pores. My skin looked softly matte and evened out but like I had nothing on it. My super oily skin stayed matte for 6 hours before I felt any need to blot, and when I did, it wasn’t even that oily. What witchcraft is this? Nothing about this product make sense to me… but it works. I will add that I don’t love the tinted balm as much. It seemed to dry down differently and wasn’t as blurring or smoothing. But the universal rocks.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Amazing!!!!! Long lasting and matte. It doesn’t move! I have really oily skin and nothing seemed to have worked till I found this bad boy here.

reviews.review_title: I use this every time I do my makeup
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I use this as a primer on my oily t zone. I love this product a lot. I feel like it does a really great job at controlling sebum without drying my skin out. I love the smell of it too. It kind of smells medicinal, but it’s not overbearing or anything. I pick up some with my finger and really rub it into my nose and surrounding pores. I’ll let it dry down for a few minutes while I do my eye brows and shadow, then use my Chantecaille Future Skin Gel Foundation on top with a beauty sponge. Really strong lasting power and very minimal oil comes through

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I kept putting this in my cart, removing it, and adding it back in for months because I could not tell what this was or how to use it.  I accidentally caught a youtu.be makeup artist talking about it and realized I am supposed to use it as a foundation,  I own several very good foundations and certainly did not require another one but purchased it anyway during the sale. I LOVE this product,  I mean LOVE IT, and have to force myself to use my other foundations,  as this product feels like nothing on once it self sets and gives a light blur coverage. It is buildable for more makeupy days and also low-key enough for errands days. A truly unique and stellar product, and I will always repurchase it. For reference, I have combination 52 year old skin, and it does not sit, break, cling to dry skin, or slip in the tzone.  Think your skin but better(an often used marketing term that I have never seen achieved until this product).

I haven't experienced pilling with any of my foundations/ tinted moisturizers. Even when I just want my shine to be toned down, this product does great at shine control!

reviews.review_text: Went from disliking this to loving it! Just had to understand how to make it work for me. It makes my skin look really nice without looking cakey, it also has good lasting power in my opinion.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: 🗣️Ms. Myrickssss, please come to the front of the class, because I need to see greatness up close.  Where have I been?! I’m convinced Danessa Myricks has cracked DaVinci code with this Yummy Skin line🙌🏾 This product has become one of my go to and secret weapon (for the past 2.5 months) after completing my skin care routine and prior to make-up application.  I have combination skin with most of my dry areas isolated to my T-zone.  Yes, I am a recovering M.O.M(milk of magnesia) user, as it was the only product that quickly absorb the extra oils in my face, while giving me the matte look I desired.  Since discovering this balm, I no longer needed m.o.m as this product controls oil secretions, while providing a beautiful natural matte like dewy glow. EXTRA PLUS-I am Fenty girl when it comes to foundation.  This product stack well with my foundation without any texture/color/ or consistency issues.  Don’t hesitate to give this product a try, you will not be disappointed🤎

reviews.review_buyer_description: Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: It was very nice and easy to use I like it a lot and I like using it it was great to use and looked very very nice with my foundation it was great I would recommend it to everyone with their foundation

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I don't tend to use primers, but this is the only exception. I get oily during summer especially with being out all day and because I love glowy products. This balm helps keep my skin less oily while not drying out my skin like other mattifying primers.  I love that it really does blur the skin underneath so my foundation lays on top a lot more smoothly and my skin looks like it's a real filter.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I can’t believe I used to do my makeup without this product!!! THIS HAS CHANGED MY LIFE!!! I have an extremely oily t zone that I get embarrassed even though I have products to “control it.” LET ME TELL YOU… THIS IS SO SIMPLE TO USE AND IT KEEPS ME MATTE EVEN WHEN IM SWEATING & 80+ DEGREES OUTSIDE!!!!! reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I LOVE this primer. I’m very picky and don’t like the silky feel of other primers. This one isn’t tacky nor silky. I have large pores and prefer matte look as it makes my pores appear smaller. My makeup stays matte all day with this on underneath it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Yummy Skin Blurring Powder is a finely milled, lightweight balm that offers a smooth, blurred finish without leaving a white cast. It provides a natural, matte look while maintaining the skin's warmth and depth. The formula is finely pigmented, blending seamlessly into deeper skin tones, making it an excellent option for setting makeup without dulling the complexion. Overall, it's a great choice for those seeking a soft-focus effect and long-lasting wear.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product about two weeks ago and have been trying it out with my regular daily makeup and it layers really good. Does leave my skin flawless. Easy to apply and doesn’t move the makeup underneath

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This a great blurring balm powder! It feels really good to apply the product to the skin and see its effects. This product has been helping me with my greasy face skin which is pretty difficult to treat sometimes so I definitely recommend it. To me works the tone 4, so pretty!

The formula blends well with all of my other makeup products and I’ve had no issues whatsoever with applying it on top of my skincare. I have combination to more oily skin and I find that it lasts all day at work and still looks great at the end of the day. I would highly recommend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: She 9. 5 was made for ME! It’s like they had my exact skin tone in mind! Melts in my skin like butter to a point where I don’t realize I have makeup on! Thank you for this formula. A little goes a long way. I use shade 10 to contour also

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin

KEY CLINICAL RESULTS: In a clinical study consisting of 31 women, studies indicated statistically significant improvements for pore appearance, texture, fine lines, and wrinkles:

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Danessa does it again. This blurring ball power is perfect for everyday use for a full face, but also serves as a wonderful contour and bronzer. This product feels like skin and it looks like it too!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I kept looking at this product for months but I was not sure what it was, or how to use it,  so I kept removing it from my dream cart but suddenly popped it in my cart last minute during the sale after watching a video of someone using it and how much it has morphed into an everyday foundation option for them(they are a professional makeup artist in L.A.). This is a balm cream that is shockingly light in texture,  not heavy,  you do not feel it sitting on your skin,  and it sort of absorbs after applying,  leaving you feeling like you are wearing nothing,  but you get smooth even toned skin. Truly a skin perfecter rather than a skin cover, your skin looks like your skin,  only better. It also stays put, does not slide or melt off, and I look just as even toned after 9 hours as I did at application.  I am shocked by how good this is. I have foundations I love but in my opinion this is better than all of them.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have oily combination skin. This works with all my products I use the Haus Labs foundation and the Doir Face and Body and it keeps my makeup in place and I don’t get oily in my usual areas

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, gray hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have normal skin and this product is what I've replaced foundation with. Lightweight, high coverage , beautiful skin like finish. You won't be able to tell there is any product on the face with this. It's absolutely gorgeous and I will never stop repurchasing this!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This isone of my favorite for oily skin  controlling the oils and giving you a beautiful natural mate finish I have combination skin and  I love how my skin looks too the texture it's creamy but becomes satin when you apply on your skin I'm makeup artist and I love it

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin

I bought one for my aunt and my grandmother as well, and both love it as much as I do.

reviews.review_title: It Works for Dry Skin If…
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Rich skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have dry skin so I noticed without a heavy moisturizer underneath, I would appear dry. Once I used their moisture balm underneath, it works.

reviews.review_title: Great for oily skin with one big caveat.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Having oily skin, I was so looking forward to having this product in my collection. Swatching it on my arm, i liked the finish and had high hopes. If you have oily skin, I can see how this product will really help mattify, blur, and control your oils. BUT If you have oily AND DEHYDRATED SKIN, then this product will not be good. I myself struggle with dehydrated skin and because this is so mattifying, it clinged to my dry patches and texture and looked VERY POWDERY (even more than my cheapest drugstore powder foundation). That being said, it is a great and innovative formula for oily skin types, but if you struggle with dehydrated skin underneath your oily skin, then this product may not be for you.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I watched so many reviews and was so sure this was going to be awesome. It wasn't. First, the texture is so weird. It starts greasy and then dries down and clings to every dry patch on your face. Second, I didn't get that beautiful blurring effect that so many others seem to enjoy. The product looked transparent on me. Third, I wore it for the first time last night, took it off when I got home, and woke up with an itchy face with red patches all over it. Not cute.

reviews.review_title: Recommend for Oily skin types only
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin

The formula is nice and easy to apply, you don’t need a lot. It has a faint scent but not a deal breaker for me, it dissipates quickly.  I think it would be great for oily skin types.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin

It gives a soft, natural finish that’s somehow matte but still makes my skin look alive. I use it as a primer under my foundation, and it just smooths everything out like a filter.

It works so well under my foundation. I also love using it alone to give me a “my skin but better” look. It so quick and easy to apply, and has become a staple in my routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is perfect for my oily skin! I use the primer and after I put this on, I just set my t-zone with powder. I'm on my third one. My skin is literally my skin but better.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Worth it!! Using this product under anything improves your makeup’s longevity!! I’ve used it for makeup under bright video production lights and my skin didn’t look oily after hours. I didn’t find it to drying/matte but I also moisturize well and pair it with natural/satin finish foundations. Matte on matte could make this feel or look cakey and dry.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I recently tried the Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder in shade 3.5, and it’s seriously amazing my perfect match! It blurs imperfections beautifully and keeps my skin looking matte without feeling heavy. I love using it as a primer; my foundation glides on smoothly and looks so natural. I highly recommend it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It’s taken me forever to finally try this powder and it was well worth the wait. This foundation is the most unique foundation I’ve ever used. The formula feels incredibly light but the coverage is perfect. I love how the foundation feels and looks like skin. It makes my skin look absolutely perfect, like I have amazing skin rather than an amazing foundation! I also love the amount of product you get as well! Although this is foundation, I will definitely use this as a contour as well. I got the shades 9.5, 10, and 11, and a full face of the Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder is an absolute game changer. I cannot wait to get my hands on more shades and more from Danessa in general! This foundation is absolutely genius and I recommend it to everyone I know now!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product is like nothing I’ve ever tried before. It somehow makes my skin look shine free and matte while also keeping it feeling hydrated. My skin looks airbrushed whenever I use this. I seriously can’t recommend this enough if you want your skin to look the best it’s ever looked.

reviews.review_buyer_description: lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have extremely oily skin and this product has been my go to for years! Only thing that can really help my skin look great!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have combination skin, and my T-zone gets oily quickly, making my foundation prone to sliding. The Danessa Myricks Balm Powder has been great for prepping and priming my skin. It blurs and minimizes pores, creating a smooth base that keeps my foundation in place. I love its texture and find it easy to apply with my fingertips. I've tried it both on its own and with a skin tint, and it gives a lovely matte finish. My makeup stays put all day without much movement, making it perfect for my everyday looks and the occasional glam makeup.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder is a good unique balm to powder. You can use this balm as a primer, highlight, contour, or foundation. It is great for all skin types to blur imperfections and keep unwanted shine away for a soft-focus and natural matte finish. I tried the shade Universal - translucent.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Porcelain skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Oh no. If you have dry to extra dry and sensitive skin, let me stop you right here. This is not the product for us.  I was hoping this balm would blur away my ageing face where even my wrinkles have wrinkles - instead it made me extra crepey and to top it off broke me out. I'm pretty sure it's lovely on oily skin but simply not for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Allure has this listed as one of their best foundations for mature skin. My experience was the opposite. Made pores look huge, actually emphasized pores that are not large. It migrated & settled into every wrinkle.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was sent this complimentary in exchange for an honest review. This is a really interesting product and I'm still trying to figure out how I like using it. I've tried it as a base so far but I may try it alone without foundation soon.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product is so good! It has a lovely finish and looks super natural. I don’t use anything with it, just a setting spray. I apply this product with my fingers or with a beauty blender. It is so easy and practical to use and it delivers what it advertises! I am so impressed with this product, will be replacing my heavy Fenty foundation for this.

reviews.review_title: So good for oily combination skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've had my eye on the Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder from Danessa Myricks Beauty for quite some time. I was genuinely intrigued by this product due to the numerous positive reviews I've come across. It's packaged in a large circular jar with a spoon. I applied it all over my face using the spoon. I wasn't sure about the right amount to use, so I was careful. I massaged it into my skin with my fingers in a circular pattern. The texture is silky and it smoothly moves across my skin. It could easily serve as a base for makeup. I believe you might not need a separate primer with this. It left my skin feeling smooth and the texture appeared better. It's light and acts more like a tint than a heavy layer. It even helps to conceal pores. It transformed my complexion, making it look more even. I'm thoroughly impressed. It feels like a natural product without being too heavy. This is incredible. I have combination skin, and it's perfect. It doesn't feel greasy and seems to manage oil well. The following day, I tried it with a primer and set it with powder. It worked wonders. My skin felt completely different compared to when I use other foundations. There was no oiliness. It also kept my makeup in place all day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this balm powder! It’s like magic in a compact. I use it every day because it does so much in one step, it blurs, reduces shine, and leaves my skin looking smooth and natural. The texture is amazing, it goes on creamy and dries to a soft matte finish that lasts all day. It’s super lightweight, so I don’t feel like I’m wearing anything heavy. Perfect for those of us who want flawless skin without all the fuss!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my absolute favorite product to use as an oily girl. There is no need to blot your face throughout the day anymore. It can be worn as is to give you an even tone or as a base and babyyyy, you’re makeup WILL NOT MOVE! Once you try it you will never be without it.

reviews.review_title: Holy grail, tinted is too orange though
reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my holy grail for oil control. I put the translucent one on as a primer on my t zone and I only have to touch up ONCE the entire day, and very lightly. Miss Myricks I owe you my life, if there was a tinted version for us pale girlies that lean more cool it would be all I could ever ask for. Most foundations lean way too orange or yellow on me and unfortunately that is the case for the lightest tinted shade. Will continue buying the universal version until I die.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is my second time purchasing this product and I love it. I don’t wear a lot of makeup so it meets my needs and provides a smooth fresh. Look to my face. Highly recommend.

reviews.review_title: A must have in my daily makeup routine
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, notSure skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I was suggested this product from a Sephora employee when I asked for an oil control product. Ladies if you have oily skin this is a must in your makeup routine. I’m very pleased with the product and hope to try more of this brand.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin

reviews.review_text: The Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder by Danessa Myricks is a must-have for anyone looking for a natural, matte finish. I tried shade 3, 3.5 and 4. reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The Danessa Myricks Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder in Universal is a must-have! It’s an amazing multi-tasker that instantly blurs pores and controls shine without feeling heavy. The texture is silky and lightweight, and it applies so smoothly, giving my skin a soft-focus, airbrushed look that lasts all day. The universal shade is sheer and works beautifully on all skin tones, giving a natural, perfected finish. Plus, it doesn’t settle into fine lines or cling to dry spots. This balm powder has become my go-to for touch-ups on the go, keeping my skin looking fresh and flawless. Highly recommend if you’re after a truly unique, blurring product!

reviews.review_text: When I first put this on, I loved how much it did to even out my skin tone with minimal effort/application, and I thought I found a new holy grail. Unfortunately, it caused a terrible reaction and made the skin around my eyes and on my cheeks red, itchy, and scaly to the point that I eventually had to go to the dermatologist and get a topical steroid to clear it up. What's weird is that I don't have particularly sensitive skin and have never reacted to anything like this before, but I'm certain this was the cause because I tried it three different times a few weeks apart and had a bad reaction each time. (I may have been in denial because I really wanted it to work!)   I don't think this is a common reaction, but I wanted to post a review so anyone with the same experience doesn't think they're crazy. (And maybe a little in the hopes that DM will reformulate what would otherwise be a fantastic product without whatever is causing my skin to freak out!)

Like I have eczema so I have to be really careful about the products I use. Typically things that are supposed to be luminous make me break out but since this didn't say it does that I figured it would be okay. Very sad that I waited so long to use it for the first time because I can't even return it now. A complete waste of money and if I use it my skin will suffer.

reviews.review_title: It just doesn’t do it for me :(
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I really gave this product a chance in every way I could. I’ve been a fan of Danessa Myricks flawless work for years, so I was ecstatic to try this product once it was available. I have sensitive, oily skin. I initially bought it with the intention of using it as a primer, and in the first weeks of using it, it made my makeup slide off and separate. I’ve changed the techniques I’ve used in application, such  as using a brush, using my fingers, applying it on top as a setting balm, etc. but no matter what, it leads to my face becoming greasy. The product also makes my setting powder separate horribly, giving me major cakeface. I wanted to love this product but it just doesn’t do it for me. I’ll likely be returning this to switch it out for a different primer unless there’s some kind of breakthrough. I’m giving the two stars because it does do an excellent job at burring your pores, and the packaging is lovely.

reviews.review_title: Amazing for staying matte on hot, humid days!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love this stuff, and I don't even have particularly oily skin!! I do use it mostly in the summer because my skin gets a lot more dry in the winter, but in summer it is AMAZING at keeping my skin from looking too shiny/sweaty/oily in the hot, humid weather. I wonder if some of the negative reviews aren't prepping the skin well and/or are applying too much? If it's highlighting dry patches, you might need to moisturize/exfoliate your skin more first. If it's looking greasy possibly you're using too much? It starts as a balm that does initially feel kind of oily and strange, but it dries down into a matte finish. I don't typically wear foundation though so I can't speak to how it might interact.  My personal process: Usually I'll apply a moisturizing sunscreen first. Then if I'm doing makeup I'll use Glossier skin tint plus possibly some concealer and cream contour/blush. Then my preference is to dig out some of this product with the little scoop that it comes with, rub that between my two fingers to liquify it a bit, and then press it into the parts of my face that need it (usually my T zone, basically, but on really hot humid days it might be everywhere). I use the universal translucent shade because I'm very fair and not really looking for coverage anyway.  I bought this once already and used every last drop! Back buying another translucent and might try out a tinted shade too.

I will definitely purchase this when my minis are gone, which won't be long because I use this almost every day.

reviews.review_text: 10/10 Love it. It feels super light weight and its the perfect color for my skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve had oily skin my entire life. I’ve fought with the blotting sheets, powders (setting, finishing, and foundation), primers and setting sprays as long as I’ve been into makeup. Nothing ever worked for me… UNTIL NOW. After skin prep I use this balm as a primer of sorts, goes on creamy and dries matte and powder like. I then use a light layer of foundation and concealer in the areas I need, lightly dab on Mac’s setting powder in my ot-zone and finish off with a setting spray. It cut my oil production in half and I only need to touch up with a blotting sheet after 7-8 hours. My makeup stays in place as well. If you’ve struggled with oily skin your entire life this could be it y’all. Remember skin prep/ proper application of all your products is vital, but as far as formula goes I’m never putting this down.

reviews.review_text: I think the negative reviewers don’t know how to use this. This is a godsend for us oily skinned girls! I put on my makeup and LIGHTLY put two fingers on the product and swirl a tiny bit with light pressure and lightly dab on my areas. It’s a balm that sort of turns powdery in the skin. I don’t know what magic this is, but it has made me way less oily! I also put it on late in the day on top of my makeup where a little shine had broken through. It stops it all up and makes me matte again! Truly amazing stuff. A little goes a long way so don’t hoop it on! skins oilyest

reviews.review_title: First review of Foundation on Sephora in 12 yrs
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After trying Estée Lauder, Lancôme, Clinique, Ilia, Sephora brand, NARS, MAC, IL MAKIAGE... etc etc this product from the first application blew my mind! I have combination skin, acne prone, large pores. Except Estée Lauder stay in place all other brands make me oily in less than an hour and I'm constantly blotting. I was very skeptical about the color match (CN 28 Ivory in Clinique Even Better) but i ordered the 3 in DM blurring balm. Also considering there were so many negative reviews. I used my fingers to apply this and I was shocked at the result. It is like a balm but when it goes on your skin it's smooth and it's matte!!!! It is really strange. The color match was spot on. It def gives a blurred look, which is surprisingly natural. The only thing to watch out for combination skin is dry patches. If you have dry flaky skin anywhere on your face, this will highlight it. When I had that issue I used warm water and cotton to gently take the skin off. So I had to reapply the product.  After 5 hours I didn't need a retouch or blotting. If you have oily, combination skin I highly recommend you try this.

It’s like the glazed donut look which is fine before bed but I don’t get why I would want that over my makeup.

Let me tell you first of all product smells like gasoline, and it does not go away. It feels greasy and very heavy on your skin and despite being promoted as oil controlling product it. Makes your skin shine like a buttered pancake. Forget about using it in any worm climate like Florida, the minute you sweat it starts coming off, and taking all other products with it. I am really disappointed and it’s frustrating they won’t allow you to return it back. Of course now I will have to go to the store and figure out why a full priced item can’t be returned, but it will take me even more time and money to get a refund. Just don’t buy it

This does take a little bit of finessing to use. I pat it with my fingers into my skin, or use a stiff brush, as dragging it will cause my SPF/moisturizer to pill if I haven't let my skincare sit long enough before applying the balm.

It blends pretty good with my concealer as well. I didn’t use a finishing powder at first because I wanted to see how it looked dried and after a few hours of wear, it did not disappoint. I especially love the way my skin looks flawless and smooth. The only reason I gave it 4-stars is because there is a really bad smell. It smells almost chemical or like car oil….I can’t really describe it other than that and it’s strong but I don’t smell it after I wear it for a while. You will have to wash your makeup utensils as well to get rid of the smell. But overall, the makeup itself is phenomenal! I really love it.

reviews.review_title: Translucent version = YES! Tinted version  = NO
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I bought the translucent originally and loved it (still do!). But I have rosacea on my cheeks so I wanted to try this to see if it might cover the redness in one step.  I have combination skin-  super dry cheeks, but oily t-zone and forehead (fun!!). When I wear the translucent, I get a nice blurred-effect primer. When I wore this one, it just made my cheeks SO dry, and made my pores look BIGGER. It also didn't dry/absorb as well as the translucent. I'm not sure if the formulas are truly different or if its just the way my skin is reacting to this tinted version, but I'm bummed to say the least. Not only were my cheeks crazy dry and patchy at the end of the day, but this never really even set  - even after putting on a setting powder, this just still kind of slid around.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin

I wear Estee Lauder Double Wear and Nars Light Reflecting foundations as well as powder foundations.  I am absolutely thrilled to say that this absolutely did not pill!!  Not only did it not roll up under my foundation, but I did not have to powder my face one single time all day long.  My pores were nicely blurred as well.  I used O/S mattifying finishing spray also.  It seems I've found my magic potion for my oily/combination skin.  Love it!!

I have been on the hunt for decades for the perfect foundation. Despite having dark marks and a pimple here and there, I do not want to look casket fresh. I previously used Lancome, Nars, Revlon, Hourglass, Fenty, etc. So, I have had my take on products. Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder combined with Juice Boost is perfection! It really does look like skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As a busy mom of three and someone navigating perimenopause, I’m always on the lookout for makeup products that are quick, effective, and gentle on my skin. The Danessa Myricks Beauty Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder has become a staple in my routine for several reasons.  What I Love:  Blurring Effect: This product excels at blurring pores, fine lines, and skin texture, leaving my skin looking smooth and natural. It’s perfect for a polished look without appearing too made-up. I wear reading glasses, which often leave marks on the bridge of my nose, but this balm minimizes their visibility effectively. Lightweight and Comfortable: The balm-to-powder formula is incredibly lightweight and doesn’t feel heavy on my skin. It’s perfect for my everyday, no-makeup makeup look. I use it after my regular morning skincare routine (serum, moisturizer, and sunscreen) without needing an additional primer. Versatile Use: Whether I’m using it as a light foundation or setting my makeup, this product holds up throughout my busy day. For longer wear, I apply a face powder over it, and my makeup stays put without moving. It doesn’t cause any skin irritation, which is a big plus. Application: I apply the balm with my fingers, ensuring my hands are clean and washed. The product spreads easily, and a little goes a long way. I haven’t had to reapply throughout the day, even with my hectic schedule. Room for Improvement: Coverage: The coverage is on the lighter side, which might not suit everyone’s needs. If you’re looking for full coverage, this might not be the best choice. However, it’s perfect for a natural, skin-like finish. Shade Matching: Finding the perfect shade can be tricky, so I recommend trying it in-store if possible. It’s crucial to get the right match to avoid looking too light or too dark. Overall, the Danessa Myricks Beauty Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder is a fantastic addition to my makeup routine. It’s quick, efficient, and leaves me looking fresh and polished all day l

reviews.review_title: I returned MILK primer after using blurring balm
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been shopping at Sephora for 15 years but this product inspired me to write my first review ever. I ran a test comparing the Universal Blurring Balm to my MILK primer (which I have been using for 4 years). This is the month of June in hot, commuting conditions in New York City. I used each primer under my Estee Lauder Double Wear foundation on back-to-back days. No difference in my activities on both days. I moisturized my face at 8:00am as I always do. I put on makeup on both days at 5:30pm, went out, and came home to sleep at midnight. So I have yet to see the maximum strength time of the Blurring Balm Powder. I was already shiny before makeup application because of my combination skin on both days. I contoured, blushed, and powdered as usual. With MILK, after 4 hours, my T-zone had a little  shine coming through that I blotted as usual. With Danessa Blurring Balm Powder I saw NO shine after 7 hours. Nothing to blot.  I would have gone longer if I didn't have to sleep. I returned my newly replenished MILK primer to the store the next day. (sorry to MILK but Danessa Myricks Blurring Balm took down your primer in my makeup bag. it is possible that MILK primer does not particularly agree with Estee Lauder Double Wear but that is not my business to research). I hardly wear makeup but will next month test out the Blurring Balm Powder under Estee Lauder Double Wear foundation from 12:00pm to 9:00pm at an outdoor event coming up. I will also do another test with my Lancome Ultra Matte Foundation on other days, using each primer. I'll report back if anything changes in the Blurring Balm Powder performance. In case you are curious- my shade in Lancome Ultra Matte is 500 Suede W and my shade in Estee Lauder Double Wear is 5 N 2 Amber Honey. Cheers!

reviews.review_title: Give a try, it doesn't disappoint.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: After using this product off and on for a few weeks, I am pleasantly surprised. There is definitely a learning curve if you're not familiar with this type of product or you struggle with mature, uneven texture, and combination to dry skin, as I do. I didn't let these challenges stop me; this product delivers. I have to pay more attention to my skin prep. l let my moisturizer and sunscreen sit a little longer before applying this product, and I prefer using a dense brush as it gives me better results. For me, less is more which includes forgoing foundation (I am fair skinned), setting powder and spray. This product wears well throughout the day. My skin doesn’t feel tight or irritated. It can settle in expression lines and dry patches if you don't properly hydrate yourself, but not enough to stop using it. Overall, I am happy with my yummy purchase and recommend it.

Don’t go for this base if you want a decent natural finish definitely. Unless you layer it making you look like a clown, it also gives no coverage and has a terrible formula. reviews.review_text: Read the lower rated reviews! if you have any type of skin flaw, beware. This product accentuates them. It has a caky, powdery finish, so it settles into your pores, making them visibly noticeable. It settles into fine lines and wrinkles. It cakes onto any dry patches of skin you may have, making them more noticeable than they are when you have a clean face. It clings to peach fuzz.  Mature ladies, this is not the product for you. Young ladies with no pores and dewy skin - you may want to give this a try because of its unique texture. I suggest also buying the brand's Kabuki brush that goes with it. It definitely helped the product go on better. For me, though, it wasn't enough and left me looking like a chalky mess. And the #1 fair color was so light that I looked like a Geisha after applying.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've used several versions of product similar to DM's Blurring Balm over the years. As ingredients and technology continue to advance, so to have the formulatons, but at the end of the day balm products are engineered to provide a powder like finish. If powder porducts don't work for you in general due to aging skin, acne, dry skin, etc., DM's Blurring Balm likely won't either. Judging by customer reviews this product is either a hit or miss for most people.  I've always liked the idea of balm-to-powder products but have yet to find a version that's actually hydrating, doesn't settle into pores, or cling to dry patches of skin. Being a huge fan of DM Beauty I went against my better judgment and purcahsed this product in Colour:1. Colour:1 matches my skin tone due to being approx. 1/2 a shade darker in real life vs.online pictures. I wasn't a fan of the scent - reminds me of expired skin care/makeup and smells a bit off.  As other reviewers have mentioned; play around with this product to find a mode of application that works best for you.  Brush application was a no-go for me. Balm immediately settled into my pores and looked patchy in other areas. BB Sponge application was more successful using a light patting motion. Unfortunately, after the product dried down, it still settled into my pores and clung to areas on my face where I have drier skin. I think this balm will be benefical for some but it's defiinetly skin specific. It'll either work for you or it won't.

reviews.review_text: First issue with this is the shade range. The shades seem super random, for example the lightest shade has neutral undertones then the next two darker shades are super yellow, and nothing in between? I thought this was maybe because the product is sheer enough that the undertone wouldn't matter as much, but it's definitely opaque enough that you can tell the undertone is off. Second, this product is suuuuuper thin in consistency (didn't expect since it's called a balm) and extremely slippery, almost oily. My face looked super streaky and the product kept moving around on my face as I tried to blend it in. It brought out all of my skin texture and emphasized dry patches I didn't even realize were there. Coverage is minimal, there is no blurring effect at all, in fact the exact opposite of blurring. I also never noticed the product turn into a powder consistency like it's supposed to, it just stayed slippery and greasy on my face (I have combo/oily skin). It also had a flatness to it that made my skin look super dull. Will definitely return.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Olive skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love skin tints because I prefer a more natural look, and Danessa's Yummy Blurring Balm Powder blew me away.  I was skeptical at first, not knowing what to expect; but boy, was I pleasantly surprised at how good this powder really is.  I have oily/combination skin that gets really oily throughout the day.  This powder not only kept my oil at bay, but my face continued to look really natural all day long.  I wish I had purchased this powder sooner and will definitely purchase more products from Danessa in the near future.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Deep skin tone, Normal skin

While resembling a heat rash, my dermatologist diagnosed it as acne cosmetica. I don't have sensitive skin and rarely react to products. This reaction is likely due to the synthetic wax ingredient. It's disappointing because the color match and coverage were ideal, especially for finding quality dark-neutral foundation products. Sadly, I had to return it.

Everyone keeps complimenting my skin. it's very light so great for ppl who don't like the feeling of foundation. can't recommend it enough 10/10 highly recommend

reviews.review_title: I didn’t like it at first but I WAS USING IT WRONG
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: It is very confusing and stressful to try to figure out the whole water-silicone shabang and I was scared it was going to pill with my other foundations or skin tints. I applied it with a brush at first and it did not blend properly I could see the bristle strokes on my face and I was very disappointed because the sunscreen (which was also used as a primer) and the moisturizer I used to prep beforehand seemed to have a mixture of water and silicones so I said “it should be compatible right?”  However, it is compatible it is just that I was not using the correct way of applying so I did not give up on it and used my fingers and BOY OH BOYYYYY THIS THING?!?! magic!!!!!!!!!!!! It is nice and smooth at first and then it sets and absorbs very quickly giving your skin a nice smooth coverage with no pilling and quickly sets on your face giving a non-greasy finish!!   I have dry to normal face and for personal experience as long as you prep your makeup properly it does not sets on your dry patches.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I initially tried  #8 “dark skin with golden undertones” and it was too warm. There is a big difference between 8 and 8.5, 8.5 having a neutral undertone and what ultimately worked for me.  I have always had extremely oily skin. I mean, shiny within an hour and if I wiped my face with paper it would turn translucent. This is the first product I’ve ever used where after an entire day out and about, my face is still matte. I also took a nap with this stuff on, which would usually leave me extremely oily, but it wasn’t. One note, if you have dry patches, they will be pronounced. I had an old breakout healing and it became a dry patch with this on.  I’m of the era where we called foundation “coverup” and NW47 or NW43 was the colour from Mac Studio fix that every brown skinned girl that I knew wore. Ive used Estée Lauder [5N1.5/6W1], Chanel Water Fresh tint in [deep/medium deep], Nars [Macao MD4], Fenty [410/420] from her very first launch, and many many more. I’ve simply been trying to work with what I can find.   I use Shiseido 510 Suede now which is the nearest I’ve ever gotten but is my winter shade.  At 35, with at least 20 years of wearing foundation, I have finally found my exact match. I use it as foundation and it’s enough coverage to cover my dark eyelids, black spots and an inch long curling iron burn on my cheek. My face has never felt so flawless.   So long story short, this product is sorcery and I’m in love.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Rich skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have literally used this everyday since I bought it. The shade that I bought is a little too dark (which is my fault) but I still love it as a primer to keep my t-zone from getting oily. I will definitely repurchase the correct shade to wear as a tint in the summer

reviews.review_title: Good product don't understand the hype
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The product itself is fine but it doesn't cover much I like the texture in the way it goes on but it honestly looks a little Dusty instead of dewy like I was hoping.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I used light medium and it really gave me a nice even, blurred complexion. strongly recommend. I used as a primer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This has been my go-to foundation for months. I have extrememly oily skin and this leaves a soft matte finish that stays matte for hours. I apply on bare skin, only over my spf, with a sponge using sweeping motions, and this gives smooth, even coverage that isn't too heavy. It does a great job of eliminating redness and reducing the appearance of blemishes, although it is light coverage so it won't hide them completely. It is very buildable, though, and I am able to acheive higher coverage by dabbing it on in certain areas that need it. Treat this like a powder, and prep skin accordingly. It WILL cling to dry/flakey skin, just like any other powder, so I make sure to moisturize heavily before bed and exfoliate every so often (I have oily skin, but am currently using Tretinoin, which makes me peel occaisionally). I set very LIGHTY with powder in areas that tend to crease, like under my eyes. However, I'd advise against setting too heavily with powder since this can lead to a cakey look (again, treat this product like a powder- there's really no need to layer powder over powder). I don't ever really use the scoop that comes with it, since the product works much better when applied with a sponge. I just dab directly into the container. I do wish there was just one more shade lighter and more cool-toned than the current lightest shade. But since it is a lighter-coverage product, I'm able to get away with using a shade thats slightly deeper and more yellow than my skin tone. Overall, I've really enjoyed this product and will definitely be repurchasing when I run out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love how this product has sosny ways to be used.  I love it as a primer, it makes my skin look airbrushed and allows me to use less foundation so I don't look too made up.  I've also used it as foundation, and it practically makes me look like I've got a filter on.  So happy I found this product, it's a must have for me.

reviews.review_title: Best Product I Ever Took A Chance On.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have oily skin, and despite using primer and matte longwear foundation, I'm usually oily within 5-6 hours.  This blurring balm is everything for those with oily skin or for those who just want a flawless look all day.  I have had to play with the application. Using primer with the product, I feel, is too much and will overly dry out your look. I do wear it underneath my foundation, so there's that. I have never experienced a truly non-transferable look with my foundation until this product. I made the mistake of getting an exact color match. Because I wear it underneath my foundation, I'm going to purchase again 2 shades lighter for a highlighted look. Exceptional product!  Can't praise it enough. Anyone experiencing issues with it, I'd suggest you experiment with application methods. I've tried sponge, brush, and my fingers.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: In loveeeee! Used it for prom and it’s amazing for oily skin!

reviews.review_text: Good bye oily t-zone! My makeup has never looked so good. It pairs well with all my foundations/skin tints. I no longer get oily. No more touch ups!!! Your makeup stays looking fresh ALL DAY! BUY. BUY. BUY.

reviews.review_title: Definite must have for oily girls
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I literally never write reviews unless a product blows me away. This product does that. I have very oily skin and usually have to touch up with powder multiple times a day. But I paired this product with the Yummy Powder Serum and my skin was nearly perfect ALL DAY. I maybe started showing a little bit of oil around the 7-8 hour mark but I truly didn’t even have to touch up. This lasted so much longer than any foundation I’ve ever tried. I was expecting super light/sheer coverage but it had a lot more coverage than I anticipated (in a good way, I would say light to medium coverage which was what I was looking for). It took a little playing around with to figure out the best way to apply it (I did a combo of using my fingers and a brush) and I did have to pat/roll it in but once it was blended, I was obsessed. I used a setting powder as well, as I always do, so I’m sure that helped too but again, it was so much better than my usual matte primer combo (makeup forever matte primer paired with benefit’s porefessional) and foundation. This will definitely be my go-to summer foundation because I always need extra oil control in the summer months plus I like lighter coverage in the summer. Also of note, I LOVE the packaging and the little spoon it comes with. You get a decent amount of product for the price and a little goes a long way. I definitely scooped out too much the first time. If you have oily skin, this is absolutely worth a try!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, red hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: OMGsh- the best makeup product I’ve ever tried- I was blown away. I initially got it for makeup touch up, but the other day I tried it as foundation (with my sponge) and I could not believe it how perfected, blurring, natural and simply amazing my skin looked! I kept looking in the mirror and I was amazed. My usual holy grail is Georgio Armani and Nars Light Reflecting foundation, but they don’t even come close to this one!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: So far, this product has surpassed my expectations. I bought the universal/translucent shade, and it is perfect under my foundation. I alternate between a powder foundation and a balm tinted moisturizer and I find it sits underneath all of my makeup so well. I don't find that it's particularly blurring, but the oil control is insane. I can't wait to see how this performs in the summer with the intense heat!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I use this before I apply my makeup and I absolutely love it! My makeup looks so flawless. If you have oily skin like me this will help you!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I realized that you don't really know how this stuff works until you try it. I played with it in-store and wasn't wowed, didn't understand why everyone was obsessed with this stuff. Then I got the translucent one as a points reward, and after actually using it the first day, I got what the hype was about. Finally, I bought the Blurring Balm in Shade 3, and have been using it for a week. I can't get enough. It completely blurs all the pores on my cheeks and around my nose, layers like a dream, and keeps me matte all day without feeling tight or crusty. I'll dare to say my makeup looks even better later in the day. I don't wear foundation, only a bit of concealer in my T-zone, because I don't like the mask-face look. Blurring Balm doesn't have much coverage, but it evens everything out while still letting my freckles shine through, and is a gorgeous base for powders, creams and liquids. It has been added to my makeup bag and daily routine. I'm 38 and have my core products that I use, and this has become one of them. I don't know what kind of magic is in this stuff, but my makeup has never looked this good! If you're on the fence, buy it! Pat it into the skin rather than swiping. You don't need any kind of other primers. Some days, if I'm not doing full makeup, I'll use the translucent balm over my skincare, add a bit of Nars undereye color corrector, a light dust of powder, blue abs mascara, and it looks great! I still can't believe how well it blurs my significant pores on my nose and cheeks!

I get oily in my t-zone and have visible pores on the area around my nose. While this is definitely very creamy and has a powdery finish, it settles into those pores around my nose AND brings out the ones on other areas of my cheeks. I did my usual skin routine of salicylic acid, my serum, light lotion and spf. I used it both with and without waiting for my skincare to settle, and it still did the same thing. The cost is not worth trying to make it work. Glad it works for others, but not for me unfortunately.

reviews.review_text: I use this mainly as a skin tint. I have normal/oily skin and liquid or stick tints end up making me look greasy. I hate setting my entire face so this being a balm to powder works so well. Makes doing my makeup quick and easy.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got this product from a Sephora favorites value kit and let me just say I am obsessed with it. I use it on my nose, where I get very bumpy skin and it really helps blur it, great for acne prone skin and make sure to try using it as a primer ❤️

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I am probably one of the oiliest people in the world lol. But this right here? It SAVED ME. I will preach this product forever now. I was afraid it would break me out, but it didn’t. It’s keeping me from breaking out because my nose and the area around it likes to be difficult lol. My face stayed PERFECT throughout my long shift at work. I really recommend

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I’m an oily girl. This felt so wonderful on my skin. But made my foundation slide right off my face. I wanted to love it. May work great for more dry skin types. It feels amazing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to love this Balm, I've seen it all over tik tok, and it looked like something I could really use. Unfortunately it really didn't work for me. I work at a spa and one of the esti's took one look at me and said I could see your pores from space. Please take whatever you have off. 😭😭 it settled into all my fine lines and obviously made my pores look much larger.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Use only if you have flawless skin. Will cling to every dry spot on your face and make it noticeable. Wish I could have returned this

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Amazing. Goes on like butter, not even an ounce of oil seeps through. It doesn’t transfer as badly as I thought it would (via the reviews) and u honestly forget that it’s there. And it blends well too

reviews.review_title: Play around with it it looks beautiful!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: There’s a learning curve to this product, its best applied with duo fiber brush, the coverage is medium, dont use powder products ie setting powder, blush highlighter on top of it if u have normal to dry skin, this balm doesn’t need to be set on dry skin, use a setting spray or refresh spray like glow recipe mist to refresh if it looks cakey, it looks brand new and fresh like initial application. But I love the clear balm for oily touch up thru out the day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I use this if I need my makeup to stay on all day! It blurs my pores so good!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I use this for my t zone only Bc I’m not a matte girly but it really helps control my oil and keeps my base nice and smooth.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: amazing and I am 44 yrs old with dry/oily skin. I love everything by Danessa Myricks

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I tried to love this. It broke up terribly and aged my skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Loved the mattifying effect and the coverage, but felt hard to put any powder products (bronzer) on top of it, which is a bummer. If you use cream products exclusively, you’ll probably dig this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product is as yummy as it’s title. It blends seamlessly into my skin. I’m always being asked what is making my complexion appear so bright and I feel like this product is key.

reviews.review_title: Oily gals, this one’s for you
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’m absolutely obsessed with this product, I’ve bought it twice, and might stockpile more just in case it goes away! I have cool-undertoned skin and I mix 3 and 4 together on my fingers to get the perfect blend. I have oilier skin, but I find this does not make me oily throughout the day, whereas other foundations or tinted moisturizers do make me oily. It goes on so smooth and satiny, and just stays beautifully glowy, which I get constant compliments on. It’s wild for strangers to compliment my skin, and it’s 100% because of the Danessa blurring balm. I cannot say enough good things about this product!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I loved the effect and it really left my skin looking gorgeous, but unfortunately this caused repeated breakouts. My skin really did not like something about this product, because it was all over. I thought I'd stop using it day to day and start using it for special events only, but the day-after breakouts were unreal. I had to return it, which was a bummer!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I was pleasantly surprised at the coverage and ease of use. Be sure to exfoliate before using ~ this has a fresh, even finish and is perfect for Zoom meetings!

reviews.review_title: Smells too strong for my skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have rosacea, and this covered my red cheeks beautifully. I should have been more careful though - it smells like noxeema and the smell of it alone caused my cheeks to get hot as I applied it. After a few hours of wearing it, the smell was overwhelming because it was right under my nose. I would love this if it were fragrance free.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was very disappointed with this product. I saw that it was supposed to blur fine lines and be very hydrating to dry skin. However, this highlighted every patch of flakiness that I had could not even  test it properly because it.looked so bad.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was really excited about this product. It didn’t work for my skin. It started to look cakey and blotchy about a hour after application. By the end of the day I started to break out. 5 days later my skin is still recovering with breakouts all over,

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: LOVE IT. My makeup usually gets oily after some hours. I have not had that issue using this as my primer. Went to a concert and had my makeup on for hours, after the concert my makeup still looked amazing

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This has a great texture and light finish for people that want sheer coverage!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: FINALLY! A foundation that does what it says it’s going to do. I apply it with a wet sponge and that coverage is perfect each time. I don’t worry about it easily transferring to my clothes, hallelujah! To make thing even better I have NO SHINE… I have oily skin and have tried all the high end to low end brands to make my skin look matte and nothing worked until NOW! I have slept in this makeup and my face still looks good. I have recommended to everyone I know.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product is insane. I have CRAZY oily skin specifically in my T zone, I’ve tried everything (primers, serums, anything geared for oily skin) and nothing comes close to this product. It’s a must have jf you have oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve tried everything to try and make this work — a damp sponge, dabbing with my fingers, brushes, exfoliating my skin, a good moisturizer, etc. but it just doesn’t melt into my skin. It clings onto dry patches (that aren’t normally there) and doesn’t help keep my oils at bay.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: If you have dry/normal skin, this is NOT the product for you. I have an extremely oily T-zone with normal skin everywhere else, and I wouldn't even dare to put this on my cheeks. This is for the girls who can make deep-fried chicken with the oil from their faces. I wouldn't even recommend it for oily skin; you would need to have greasy skin.   However, if that is the skin you have, this product is for you!! I only use it where I get really oily, or I use the product as my foundation as I have the tinted one. I only use it before my makeup. I don't like the shade match for the tinted so next time I will get universal because this is a requirement for the summer!   I take off one star because it smells like gasoline. I don't know if that smell is safe, but the product works, so I keep using it. Would be perfect if they could change the smell.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried this product a few times with different skin prep and application methods to give it a fair shot. Each time it collected in every single pore and clung to dry patches I didn’t even know I had!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dark skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've been looking for this for 30 years as I am the most oily person I've ever run across. Nothing, and I mean nothing has ever kept me this matte for 9 hrs without any retouching. It's unbelievable. Oily girls feel my pain, but this right here is the one. I don't write reviews, but I had to put everyone on notice about this

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Double wear was my ride or die but started to feel like it was too heavy of coverage but all light weight foundations just slipped off my face after a couple hours! This is my new fav!!! With the correct skin prep this is my new favorite foundation! Light weight and looks skin like!! 10/10 for this oily gal!!

reviews.review_title: Not was what i was expecting

It somehow through reviews or research, led me to buy L'Oreal True Match Nude Hyaluronic Tinted Serum & that one is as close to exactly what I've been looking for as it gets.

reviews.review_title: This was a no for me

I think it had some kind of scent in it, which I can’t use fragrance on my face, I’d say don’t buy this if you have sensitive skin or dry skin

reviews.review_text: My first ever review. This actually work. I have tried a lot of primers to help with my oily skin and all will last about an hour and I’m oily again. This last all day. 14 hours and still not oily.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Rich skin tone, Combination skin
