reviews.review_title: Good bye foundation hello balm powder!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this balm powder. I don’t wear makeup everyday but when I do I like using this blurring balm powder. It’s creamy and hydrating, leaving my skin looking dewy and natural. I like to top it with some powder and bronzer J because I find it a bit achy b

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My everyday make up! It looks and feels just like skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The balm is so soft and gives a great base for my foundation!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got this as a sample size and it’s lasting me a good while. I use it as a primer under my regular foundation. It’s the first thing I’ve ever used that actually controls the oil in my t-zone. Which makes my foundation last a lot longer. I love this stuff!! I’ll buy the full size when I run out of the sample size.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wanted to like it, but just can’t get pass the smell…

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The best skin tint I have ever used. I have oily skin so have to blot throughout the day regardless what I use. I love that this is so lightweight but buildable. it is so quick to apply. I prefer to do it with my hands to make sure it is thoroughly rubbed into my skin, do not recommend using a brush with it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is my favourite complexion product right now. And a black woman made it mmkay? I mean nuff said. But it makes me look so natural. Skin is skinning. Oil production is kept mostly at bay and whatever does accumulate at the end of the day adds to the glow. I have it in clear which goes well under other foundations. Heck you can even layer foundation on top of the the regular ones. Paid for it with my own money cause you know most of these incentivized reviews are suspect. And it was worth every dollar!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I did not have any luck with this. Sat on top of my bare skin as well as any makeup. Did not absorb oil. Caused my tinted moisturizer to smudge like crazy. Also did not notice it blurring textured areas or mattifying at all.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I tried to use this product on two separate occasions and it caused an allergic reaction each time, at first I thought it was another product I used in combination with this product but the second time I used it I instantly became red/itchy after washing my gace.

reviews.review_title: Wanted to love, not for combo/oily skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Y’all I wanted to love this so bad, but it was a mess with the rest of my products. Never sunk into my skin, sat on top and then creased my concealer the second I applied it. Looks okay on my dry patches, but is a mess anywhere oily sadly.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: A-MAZING!! My new daily must have. Perfect skin with just a tiny scoop!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This never sinks into skin, but rather sits on top waiting to be ruined by a finger or a tissue. I’m typing this with a red ring around my nose, about to correct with my tried and true BB cream. Not worth it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Perfect match for my skin. Goes on smoothly and leaves a subtle glow. Absolutely love it! Also doesn't require a lot to give a smooth clear base for makeup. Totally worth it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is now my number one foundation ever! First of all this shade is my exact perfect match, I don’t think I’ve ever had a shade match like this, it goes on so smoothly and has great coverage. I loves that it sets to a matte finish. My husband always compliments my makeup when I use it so I hope they never ever stop making this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Do not buy in the shade Universal or if you don’t have oily skin. This did absolutely NOTHING. If you would like to put a balm on your face, I suppose it would accomplish that.

reviews.review_title: Controls oil like no other with ZERO dryness!!!!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got a free sample of this (NOT in exchange for a review or anything!!) using a code for a promotion Sephora had going on (it was awhile ago) which I added to my cart. I didn't try it out immediately because I didn't think much of it. I got the clear one and only tested it as a primer, not as a powder. When I first put it on my face, it felt kinda oily. Not a heavy greasy feeling, its not gross feeling at all. It just looked rather shiny on the skin so I thought the one I got had gone bad. I tested it out anyways and was shocked to see that the oily feeling didn't cause my makeup to slide around. Quite the opposite actually! I primed half of my face with the One/Size Secure the Sweat primer (which claims to make your makeup waterproof + sweatproof) and the other half with DM Yummy Skin Balm in Universal. Neither sides had any separation or anything too drastic, but the noticeable thing was that the DM was matte- it literally looked like I went and blotted it with a POWDER. One/Size had a slight, slight shine, not even anything crazy, it just looked like a drastic difference in comparison to the DM. I was beyond impressed to say the least. The fact that it applies without over-drying is the cherry-on-top, it controls oil WITHOUT drying out your skin. Danessa Myricks is a genius. Added the full-size to my cart so fast.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I love Danessa Myricks Blurring Balm. This is my go to. I bought the #8 first but it was a little light for my skin so I bought 8.5. I tested it out on my skin and it's a better match for my skin. This balm controls my oily skin and looks flawless especially since I suffer from acne breakouts, visible pores, and dark marks.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love wearing this on my makeup no makeup days. It has an airbrushed finish and makes my skin look flawless, I don't even have to touch up throughout the day. It is light coverage but can build to a medium coverage.  I like the idea behind the spoon applicator it comes with but it's not my favorite. Also, if you have really dry skin, this may not be ideal for you unless you make sure your skin is properly prepped.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Received this in the Sephora Favorites Fresh Face Makeup Kit and I love it! It goes on smoothly and feels nice and weightless. It made a noticeable difference to the appearance of my skin.

I absolutely love this yummy skin blurring balm powder! It makes my skin look so flawless and smooth! I was looking for a new holy grail product and have finally found it in this ! It is the best base for my makeup and I can’t recommend enough

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: When I say that my oily/combination skin remains matte throughout the entire day, I truly mean it lasts from morning until night. There's absolutely no oil breakthrough, and my makeup maintains its fresh appearance for a full 12 hours. I don't even need to apply foundation over my shade 10; just a setting powder does the trick.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product helps you achieve the ideal no-makeup makeup appearance. I adore the natural and skin-like finish of my makeup, and the delicious skin-blurring balm powder delivers just that. This might not be for those with dry skin

reviews.review_title: Effectively works on my dark spots!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The blurring balm powder lives up to its promises by effectively concealing my dark spots and uneven skin, giving it a flawless appearance that stays on longer throughout the day. It’s smooth texture feels luxurious on the skin, easy to apply, and I appreciate that it doesn't feel heavy or thick. I have noticed that this powder does a great job of reducing the visibility of pores, fine lines, and uneven skin texture, ensuring a smooth base for makeup application. The packaging is elegantly designed and compact, making it convenient for quick touch-ups while on the go.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: i saw the hype and bought it, wish i hadn’t. the spoon applicator seemed like a cool idea but it’s actually just annoying getting it out and wiping the product on your fingers brush or sponge. plus i don’t like my makeup looking dirty so then i have to clean off the spoon. this was awful to spread with my fingers. a brush was a little better but it felt really dry and caked. i didn’t notice any blurring or pore filling. haven’t noticed any transfer which is a plus i guess. overall, the concept was neat, wish it would’ve worked on me, it’s fine, nothing amazing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product has really helped my look go from greasy to glowing. I use it on my t zone area and it helps control my oil throughout the day. I’m really surprised  at how well it worked but I’m super happy with the results. I use a beauty sponge and apply a thin layer to my problem areas and it lasts all day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Saw the hype around this product and wanted to give a try for a while. I finally gave in to it and regret it. Creases bad, looks terrible & cakey. Gets worse the more you try to fix it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Rich skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love it, I just wish there was more product, and less transfer.

reviews.review_title: Perfect as a Primer or Your Skin but Better Tint
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder from Danessa Myricks is AMAZING! I have gone through 2 of the translucent shades already and I was really stoked to try the tinted shades. My perfect shade is 3.5. I personally use this product as a primer. However, with the tinted shade, you can definitely use this product for a no makeup, makeup look. I do that on days, when I don’t want full glam, but I want to have a little something on the skin. It’s lightweight and not greasy. Having oily skin, this product works so well for me. Highly recommend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Danessa Myricks is always giving us “skin” when it comes to her makeup products. This Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder is amazing. It feels great when applying it to the face and it just makes the skin look smooth and amazing!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Deep skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is my go to for sheer coverage! I received shades 9, 10, and 11 and they’re all perfect for different outcomes! I like to go for the no make-up, make-up, dewy look and this burring powder gave me just that. It’s super rich, hydrating and smoothing! The packaging is super compact and easy to take on the go.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Danessa never misses! This product has been a game changer for my oily skin. I saw such a difference in my skin after a night out I looked like I just applied my face. It has a pleasant smell and it applied very smoothly.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: So bummed, I really wanted this to work for me, and thought it would since my skin starts the day dry but gets oily over time. I’ve tried every method of application—fingers, sponge, brush—and all methods made the product cling to my flakes and highlight my pores. It’s is such a smart, innovative product—I’ll keep trying in hopes it works!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Shade is the perfect patch for my skin. The formula is light and buildable and I honestly like how compact it is. Comes with a spatula that clicks into the top so you aren’t digging your fingers into the foundation. I personally like to scoop some out and rub it in like you would a skin care items. Nice flawless skin like finish put you would probably have to add layers for it to be full coverage

reviews.review_title: Skip this and buy the balm blushes instead
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I received the translucent universal blurring balm powder as a special offer with my other purchases. This product sucks. It feels like Vaseline, it does not blur and when used on top of makeup, it disrupts everything you put it on top of. Maybe the ones with pigment are better, I don’t know but do NOT buy the universal shade. I tried using this on bare skin and even that did nothing. No blurring whatsoever and it didn’t even fully set. It felt like I just had a layer of goop on my face. I tried using a small amount and also a heavier amount. No matter what it just felt gross and pointless.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product is seriously amazing! It gives my skin a flawless, airbrushed finish while still feeling lightweight. I love how it blurs imperfections and keeps my skin looking smooth all day long. It's definitely become a staple in my makeup routine. Highly recommend giving it a try!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: These Blurring Balm Powders have been my Holy Grails !! It's like a filter in a compact, it blurs the skin perfectly, the coverage is AMAZING and it literally saved me so much money and time not having to buy and wear expensive foundations when I want to look effortlessly polished and put together. They're so easy to apply,  they literally give the perfect coverage every time, and they last, these have definitely been a lifesaver and will forever be on my top shelf. Highly Recommend !!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I really love the texture of the Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder.. It glides on my skin and buffs out to a really smooth, matte finish. It is buildable to pretty full coverage and doesn’t feel heavy at all! Love that a few strokes gives my face an even appearance with minimal effort.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this product on a whim.  I saw it at Sephora and I thought it was similar to the Cover Girl Liquid makeup that I used to buy in the mid 90s.   I was wrong.  It's more translucent,  but does offer some coverage.  The shade 2 has yellow tones to it, which perfectly acts as a colour corrector for my redness.   I was disappointed at first, but for the CAD $50 price tag, I was determined to figure it out. 4 stars because I was expecting a different product,  however I am thrilled to have a colour corrector that goes on smoothly and offers coverage.  Will buy again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Color match was great , and the finish is nice if you like a matte look. This was a little too matte for my taste and I felt it aged my mature skin, a dewy finish is more my speed as I felt a bit ‘dried out’ looking. I

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I used to work as a sephora employee when i discovered this product last year it got recommended to me by a Licensed beauty advisor and IM SO GLAD i took her advice. This palm powder that i use as a primer works wonders. it keeps me matte all day long . As someone with acne prone skin and really oily skin this has changed my makeup game for life.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using this as foundation for a couple weeks and really love it. I like applying with a dense brush (I've tried a few different brushes). The finish is very natural, light coverage so I need to conceal blemishes but it works well with other products (I've tried concealer, powder bronzer, cream and powder blush). I love how it looks like my skin, but better.  If you have very dry skin, you may need to up your skincare. I have combo skin and live in a very dry climate. The product isn't too dry for me but something to look out for. I'm curious to see how it wears in a humid environment! The only reason it's not a 5-star product is that it wears a little yellow for me. I have cool undertones and there isn't currently a cool shade for me. If they expand the shade range, I will be the first one to purchase!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Olive skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm a sweaty/oily girl and this balm powder is perfect for counteracting that! I can't wait for warmer weather to really see how it holds up. It's so easy to use, the spatula built into the lid is hygienic and helps to scoop the product out. Once applied it turns from a balmy texture to powder and really gives a naturally matte finish! Dry skin babes: make sure you prep your skin with tons of moisture beforehand

reviews.review_title: Great matte finish and blends beautifully!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Dark skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: *Go to the end of this review if you want skin color comparisons.* This product works well as a primer or for setting foundation. How many products can pull double duty like that?! My skin is balanced and can sometimes feel dry, and I love matte finish but never like the look of powder. This product is the perfect solution! The size was also bigger than I expected, and for the way it works and blends well with other foundations, it's a good cost value. You truly only need the tiniest bit for a whole face. Like pea sized (maybe a large pea).  I use brushes for everything but preferred my finger tips for this product. On its own you get a light coverage that evens out skin tone with a matte/airbrushed look. On top of the Yummy Skin Tint, it's close to a medium coverage. It wore well all day, no touch ups needed - and that was without setting spray! Although it was great as a foundation primer, it didn't like it as an eyelid primer. You'll still need something on top of this if you truly don't want eye shadow creasing.   Color match was perfect! For comparison references: This product: 8.5 Yummy Skin Tint: 12 Pat McGrath Skin Fetish: MD26 Tom Ford Traceless: Chestnut MAC Pro Longwear: NC50 Tarte Hydroflex: 54H Deep Honey Tarte Shape Tape: 53H Deep Honey

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: i have never found a product that matches my skin tone to PERFECTION. i would say it's a matte finish but it looks super airbrushed. the balm powder line can run kinda warm but, they are adding more shades it seems since the 8.5 is pretty new!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my holy grail oil control product that actually works all day long. My skin is VERY oily in my t-zone. There's not another product that has worked as well for me. It is really innovative and I can't live without this. I can wear this and a little bit of concealer and I feel put together

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product so much. I’ve been searching for years for a complexion product that delivers this kind of finish. I mix it with the yummy skin serum in shade 10 and it’s just perfection.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Still trying to figure out if it’s right for me. Tried with all kinds of primers, powders by itself all of it. I think my skin is just too dry for this product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This balm powder is so nice !  The packaging is so pretty it has a miniature spoon that clips in on the top. I was surprised at how well it works simply bc it seems as a balm but once scoop it is a powder. I use it as a natural contour and it is perfect. It’s so cute and compact I love Ty:))

reviews.review_buyer_description: black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Perfect color match, but it caused an allergic reaction.   I could feel my skin tingling and when I washed it off my skin was red and irritated   my skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Omg this might be the best makeup product I have ever used. It just makes my skin look so even and perfect. I also tend to be an oily t-zone girl as I have combination skin but not with this. I’ve never used a product that just looks better the longer I wear it and this is definitely that. I’ve been wearing it as my foundation replacement and it’s already a staple in my makeup routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Bomb.com Does what says it will do. Will purchase again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This multi-use balm powder leaves my skin with a gorgeous natural matte finish. This product is not just a mattifier; it blurs imperfections, boosts coverage, and keeps shine at bay. I love the versatility—whether I use it alone, as a primer, or to set my foundation, it delivers a flawless, soft texture. The spatula in the compact ensures hygienic application, and it feels lightweight yet provides substantial coverage. I love how it maintains hydration while achieving a shine-free, natural look that lasts all day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love the blurring balm powder. It has a natural matte finish to the skin and looks so pretty. I’ve worn it all day and it lasts. I like how easily it applied and how smooth it looks on the skin. I definitely recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: At first I thought this was the weirdest product. I put it on my prepped skin and didn’t notice any thing going on. I have combo skin with small pores so I don’t usually need anything blurring or mattifying. One day I decided to use this as a primer in my t-zone and BAM, I couldn’t believe how blurred it was. There is a learning curve to using this. I personally use the bottom of a sponge and really work it into my skin to avoid pilling or patching. What I really think this would be great for is an alternative to powder for dry skin. I have used it to set my under eyes with the same method using the sponge… NO additional creasing, my under eyes feel super hydrated, and they look incredibly smooth. It will feel balmy the rest of the day if worn as a topper, so if you’re not into that save your money  TLDR: You WILL need to practice because it can get rowdy quickly, but I think dry skin folks out there will love it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got a sample size with my points and it’s going to last me like a month This gave my skin the perfect blur and matte finish all day long and I work in food. I got home and still looked fresh.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Very good on my skin. I love the finish and it last all day. The oiliness does not seep through. I love that the coverage is buildable, so I can have a full coverage or medium which is great. Definitely recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Very unique base product! First off, there’s a lot of product in the pan and you only need a little bit to get a flawless complexion. The cream to powder consistency literally melts onto the skin and give a medium plus coverage that’s buildable to full but most importantly, it looks sooo natural and can conceal a great deal of dark circles too . I’ve been Using it daily and it saves me so much time when getting ready.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As a former makeup artist and beauty enthusiast, I have tried so many different types of innovative and new products. This one is really worth the hype. This is my new go to for first step makeup application. The balm to powder texture is very easy to blend on skin (I use my hands!) and can be worn alone for a very nice even coverage or underneath a foundation (my routine). When I say this makes my skin look flawless all day! Just wow. I don't know how this product works its magic but it manages to provide coverage, hydrate, and keep my face from melting away half way through the day. Highly recommend to try as it's one of a kind!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I was gifted this product in return for a review. But in my honest opinion I love it. I just wish they had a shade 7.5. 7 is a little light but 8 is too dark. There is an 8.5 option, so I feel like they can make 7.5.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: There are so many ways to use it as recommended in the ‘how to use’ section above which is so cool. I tried the shade 3.5 and the shade match was really good. Unfortunately, it didn’t work for my combo - leaning dry skin right now. I just started using it and it breaks out my foundation when I use it as a primer and if I use it alone, I see dry patches as the day goes along. I am definitely more dry than in the winters so I will probably give it another try in a couple months. I do think this is a better fit for oily skin types.

reviews.review_title: universal is the only way to go (as primer)
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, Porcelain skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have EXTREMELY oily skin, and nothing has ever been able to keep the shiny layer of grease at bay like this puppy in the translucent shade specifically. I tried shade one like a year ago because the upsalite sounded appealing. Unfortunately, while it helped with the sebum production, it also emphasized texture and separated quickly. Something about the translucent shade does the complete opposite? Makes my pores/texture disappear and somehow manages to prevent me from looking like I smeared crisco on my face. I don't need to touch up or even set with powder? Holy grail status for oily babes.

reviews.review_title: Just get it. Don't wait like me.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Olive skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I had been planning for months to get this and just didn't get around to it. I didn't think it was going to be that groundbreaking. WRONG. It was! My makeup has NEVER looked this good. It looks the same at the end of my work day as when I applied it. My mind is literally blown.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My skin but better!!! I hate the feeling of foundation on my face and I don’t feel this AT ALL!!! The color match is beautiful and its blends in effortlessly. Definitely recommend to anyone interested

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This formula feels amazing in my skin. A little goes a long way with this product. It has a sheer coverage but would be perfect for a light makeup look or underneath a more full coverage foundation. I love the packaging and how the spoon is a magnet on the top. I included a picture of me wearing the balm powder and that is all I am wearing with a little bit of blush. I used my fingers for application but you could also use a dense brush.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: SOOOO good. If you have dry skin and uneven tone, this will do an amazing job with both. It hydrates while doesn’t making it feel greasy and doesn’t cling to dry patches and makes my skin look airbrushed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Goes on beautifully. Melts into skin. Not a lot of coverage but definitely blurring effect

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This product is incredibly unique and beautiful. My skin is dry but I didn’t have any issues with it clinging to my problem dry areas. I love the finish and especially how flawless my skin looks. This wear time will last you longer than expected.

reviews.review_title: For the no makeup- makeup looks
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I want to start off with saying that it’s a very blend able consistency & it comes with a lot of product. I feel like it didn’t work well with my other products things where kind of slipping off my face / splotchy. I can see it working well with a minimal makeup look but not for full glam.

reviews.review_title: Not a fan of this one.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately, not a fan. The color seemed to match in the store, but was way off when I got home. Also, my store didn’t have any darker options. Most importantly the feel of the makeup. It just sat in top of my skin. It didn’t seem to melt no matter how much I rubbed it in. I tried beauty blender and brush and still got the same result, thick and cakey. I am disappointed in this product, but will try others for sure!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brunette hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using the mini translucent I received with 100 points. When used over my sunscreen and moisturizer this product is amazing. it really blurs my 40 year old skin so I feel confident skipping foundation or concealer. I just layer a cream blush and I'm good to go.  I like using this product with a medium dense angled brush. I dab it directly into the pan. A little goes a long way. Highly recommend it!   I have combo skin btw.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’m blown away by how natural this balm powder looks! It’s literally your skin but better. It goes on like butter and blends perfectly. This is great for an everyday work look and lasts all day. I’m in love with this product!

reviews.review_title: Perfect for no makeup look! Shine free filter!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I rarely leave reviews but I am in shock at how well this product works for me. I have very combo skin that is flaky (because of tretinoin and retinol), yet super shiny and oily on the forehead and around the nose (I need to blot throughout the day). This product has made my skin look like a filter. Flawless, super smooth, natural, doesn't crease, with no shine. I take a tiny amount on my finger and just tap it into my oily areas or wherever I want coverage for that 'no makeup' look. If I use the tapping motion it also doesn't highlight the flaky skin. I can't vouch for using it as a full on foundation, but for my needs, where I just want a very skin-like natural look it is perfection.

reviews.review_title: My favorite product! A must have!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Such a GREAT and UNIQUE product! I’ve never tried a product like this, is so versatile and easy to use. My favorite way to use it is applying it with my fingers on my oily Tzone and I love that it keeps it matte but not dry, it’s a comfortable matte look. Also, OMG it makes my skin look super smooth so if you have texture this will work well too.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: So idk what Miss Danessa put in this but it’s amazing, innovative and the best makeup product I’ve tried in years! I’ve been wearing it alone without powder or concealer and my skin looks flawless and healthy, literally my skin but better! Also I have dry skin and this did not dry me out or look patchy, my skin as I mentioned looks healthy and glowy. This will be perfect for the warmer months and my only con is I didn’t try it sooner.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My base has never looked better, tried this balm a couple times and I am shook, I used it under my foundation and even alone , you can wear it however you want it would still look amazing. It’s blurring and smooth. No creases or nothing. I received this in exchange for this post.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: she ain’t joking when she says oil absorbing. I wore this to the gym, on a run, in the shower, and my face was still matte afterwards. I’m going to buy two more colors. Perfect for oily skin

reviews.review_title: It helps reduce the size of pores
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I used it for the first time today and had great results! I love how it comes with a spatula, which makes it easier to get the right amount of product without getting your hands all over it. It has a slight scent, which I could compare to petroleum jelly. However, it's not as strong as petroleum jelly. It's not off-putting at all. It goes on very smoothly, and it helps reduce the size of pores. I haven't used it under foundation yet, but so far, I like it a lot!

reviews.review_title: Danessa  did her big one with this!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is an oily skinned girls best friend. I was skeptical at first because I just knew there was no  way a balm powder could have good coverage and control oil. This blurring balm powder does just that. The coverage is perfect for an everyday loo or a no makeup, makeup type of look. It really does blur the look of pores and keeps the oil in my t-zone in check.

reviews.review_title: don’t use if you have acne
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This blurring balm powder is nice for those “no-makeup-makeup days” but I wouldn’t use it for everyday wear. As someone with combination, acne-prone skin I found that this definitely blurred and kept me matte throughout the day. However, I did find that the product clings to dry patches and separates over acne so it doesn’t cover acne well at all. That being said, if you’re trying to hide blemishes I highly recommend using a product that creates a barrier over any acne under this product or don’t use this at all. I think it works amazing if you have clear skin, just depends on your skin type.

reviews.review_buyer_description: black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have never had a smoother looking base. I even wear this by itself. This blurring balm is so fun to apply with the little spoon. I was afraid to mess it up. Don’t worry if the shade looked dark as it looks different on the skin. I got the shade 6 and it worked.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have never tried a foundation product quite like this one before and I was definitely pleasantly surprised! It was super easy to apply with my fingers and didn’t seem to settle into my lines. The coverage was medium and lasted all day without touch ups

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This was my first experience with a Danessa Myricks product, and I have to say I'm super impressed with not only the benefits the skin blurring balm powder provides but also the gorgeous, high-quality packaging she presents. This powder is so creamy and smooth, applying beautifully to my skin without leaving it feeling heavy and a little goes a long way. I love the instant blurring effect it delivers, that it acts as a great balancing product and the stunning matte finish it gives. I also really like that it can be used for a number of things, including a primer or bronzer. This is definitely my new go-to foundation for when I'm in the mood for a quick, natural look!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really love how well this Tinted Balm powder works to provide light coverage in a shade that matches my skin closely. The application is easy and this stays on for most of the day. I love that this doesn't dry out my skin either. I would recommend to others.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Yummy Skin blurring balm is my go to foundation for a quick, natural look. The formula is so smooth and blends flawlessly, and helps my skin look dewy and radiant with more even coloring. I use a few different shades to highlight and contour, and the colors are so easy to blend together.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product did nothing to blur or reduce pore appearance .  I did not see any difference after applying this .

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The moment I received this blurring balm powder I fell in love with it. This is the perfect lightweight foundation that helps even out skin tone and diminish redness. This is a perfect lightweight product for the summer!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Wow, what a product! A little goes a long way for coverage and it's so easy to use. I tend to have normal-dry skin, so the matte formula does show the dry flakes on my skin. I'll probably use this product to blur certain areas, like my pores.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is my most favorite product from Danessa I have all the shade can possibly used for a full face there amazing for one in done is way to used and love I don’t need to set it my dry to normal love a great natural look.

reviews.review_title: Not a great product for my skin type
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product did not work well for me at all. I am an oily skin tone, and have larger pores around my nose, so I generally use silicone based products. it made my texture really exaggerated and left me looking greasy. I was not a fan at all, but this may be an okay product for anybody with very dry skin

I’ve been wanting to try this for so long and it did not disappoint! Such a smooth foundation that’s literally undetectable. Perfect for those who are looking for something that does not need to be set.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: How have I lived without this product??! This foundation is m extremely long wear and has so many uses making it extremely versatile. I love wearing it under a glowy foundation to help control the oil while creating a flawless base. I also love to use it as a bronzer in a deeper shade. You can layer it to make it have more coverage. This stuff is my favorite!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Do you remember Benefit Dr. FeelGood Balm? The universal tint is basically exactly the same thing as that and the other tints are just colored versions of Benefit Dr. FeelGood Balm. I was so bummed Dr. FeelGood was discontinued. It was the kind of thing that you could use as a primer or a setting powder. It had a balmy kinda creamy feeling as you warm it up on your fingers or you could use a brush or sponge to gently and lightly press it in to your skin and then it basically had a light finish as if it was a powder so you would have a blurred/filtered effect on your face and be slightly more matte finish but still have a dewy glow. Best of both worlds in more ways than one. The product is multitasking.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have oily combination skin and was excited to try this out for a long lasting look. The instructions say to use your fingers for application, but I saw on the DM’s TikTok they also used a wet sponge. I prefer a sponge to apply my foundation so I did that. Keep in mind, I had just prepped my skin really well with skincare. My face was super hydrated, but this product clang to one pimple and further made my nose look very textured. Almost immediately it was separating on my face. I didn’t use a primer either so I’m not sure what made it look so bad. Only pro was the full coverage. Unfortunately I will not be using again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I had high hopes for this blurring balm powder but no matter how I apply it, it won't sit right on my skin (with primer or without). It's supposed to blur my textures but it amplifies it instead. I see more of my pores and rough patches unfortunately. I've tried applying it with a sponge, brush, and my fingers but couldn't achieve a flawless blurred look. It's really sad because I think the color match is great, but I can't be seen outside like this.

reviews.review_title: 45 with combination skin and it was a no for me..
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to love this but it made my pores look worse. It does mattify well but that wasn't a good thing for my skin. It looked dry and thirsty. Packaging is lovely and maybe the tinted version works differently. Not sure.

reviews.review_title: Sigh Sooo Not for Mature Skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve used other Danessa Myricks complexion products before and loved them, so I was really excited to try her Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder. The packaging is sturdy, easy to open (but not too easy that it falls open) and the little spoon/scooper is  great way to keep the product from getting contaminated. The product is probably great for people who don’t have wrinkles but for those that do? My foundations all ended up settling into my lines like they never have before when I used this as a base. 😓

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is my absolute favorite makeup product!! I’ve been using since it came out. I have oily skin and this is the one thing I found that always keeps me matte. I also like that it doesn’t make me look dry, it almost has the perfect balance to absorb oil based upon my skin so it doesn’t dry me out. I use the universal for Client but I use shade for myself, and it works with every foundation I’ve tried with it so far. Also really pretty as like a tinted moisturizer if you wear it alone.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Omg, the best and the shades match so perfect. Such an essential and the packaging is so so gorgeous. I Love them so much, couldn’t resist this perfection. Thank you so much, definitely recommend them.

reviews.review_title: I love it and it went on smoothly I wear this only
reviews.review_text: I love this I would order it again I love it I would tell my friends and family about it

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: One thing about Danessa Myricks: she never fails at coming through with unique products. This is no exception: an oil-controlling balm-like foundation/primer/bronzer??  Here are some of my observations: the universal shade seems to be the most oil-controlling. It’s actually a really big difference in my opinion, so if that’s why you are buying this, I might suggest you opt for that (or combine it with the tinted versions)  Secondly, a little goes a long way! There’s a scoop included in the packaging, and while it’s absolutely adorable, I find that it’s best to just lightly dip my fingers in, warm up the product in my hand, and then spread it onto my skin. This gives a lovely, instant blurring effect and acts great as a balancing product. As far as shades offered, these do run a little lighter and a little warmer, but overall are surprisingly adjustable.  Finally, I haven’t seen anyone mention this but it might be that I have a tricky skin type: this makes an INCREDIBLE bronzer on me!? I have dry skin but an oily scalp. It’s so frustrating that my foundation breaks up around my hairline the most! Overall, I am so glad I had the chance to try it as there really is nothing else on the market quite like this product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I was SO excited to try Danessa Myricks blurring balm powder. I tried shades 1, 2 and 3, and found that shade 1 blended the best with my skintone. I like to use a wet beauty blender after to make sure all the product is evenly blended. My skin has been dry this winter and I don’t notice it clinging to any dry patches.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is a unique game changer and I loved it! It applies like a cream, smoothly into the skin but becomes a powder natural matte finish. It provides light coverage but is buildable for medium coverage. I love how it gives a natural, blurring effect without drying skin! The shade match was great. This product is versatile, I used it as  a primer/foundation in one  but I can see its use for contour or conceal! I can’t say enough how much I love it, just go ahead and buy!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder has that Wow Factor everytime I use it! It applies so effortlessly, its absolutely flawless on the skin, it looks like my skin but better! It's this perfectly creamy balm but it also turns almost to a powder but it's not dry or cakey, you don't have to worry about streaks or separation, it's just so incredibly unique and stunning! If your in a rush and need to quickly look your best this will give you the flawless look that will still have you in awe at the end of the day! This is that one product that always shows up everytime I use it, it works great as foundation, concealer and there's no need for powder to set! I'm so in love with this blurring balm that I even use a different shade for bronzer!! There's always that one product that gets you excited and this one is it for me!! I am shook by how beautifully this balm wears all day, it's now my daily obsession!!

reviews.review_title: Say goodbye to crease lines with this product!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is such a fabulous and innovative product! This blurring balm is the perfect solution to getting crease lines from powder. I am over 35 and my fine lines under my eyes always crease with too much powder. Not so with this blurring cream! It’s works like a powder but it’s more hydrating and won’t show your lines like powder does. Instead it helps to hide lines and blends your makeup together seamlessly. Also you are sure to find your matching shade because they have a huge shade range which I love. Such a great product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Normal skin

I always love my Danessa Myricks products and this is at the top of my list.

It has a matte finish which I’m normally not a fan of but this is more of a natural skin like matte that looks so beautiful on the skin. For me it didn’t emphasis my texture and it wore well throughout the day. I know this can be used a lot of different ways and as a makeup artist I’m so excited to continue trying out different ways to use this balm.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder helps to blur imperfections and keep unwanted shine away for a soft-focus, natural matte finish. It’s so easy to apply with fingertips and only a small amount is needed. The innovative technology really helps to blur pores and fine lines. This balm definitely controls oil and gives a beautiful filtered appearance.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I loved this balm, in the winter I don't usually use matte makeup because it tends to dry out my skin too much and this product surprised me. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_title: The BEST primer for oily skin!!

reviews.review_text: I’m 32 and have been using various primers since I was about 16. I have very oily skin, and this is the best primer I’ve ever used!! I don’t even have to use blotting sheets when I use this as my primer, and it works really well to prime my lids too. If you have oily skin, this is a must!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I usually opt for lighter makeup looks and my go-to is usually SPF with a tinted moisturizer. Whilst looking for new products to try in this category, I came across this balm to powder complexion product, which had me pretty curious to try it. This balm powder is a cross between a push cushion and powder in a vegan-friendly formula which is clean and good for skin. Its main purpose is to provide a smooth, natural finish that blurs and refines skin, leaving it texture free. I saw it also has Upsalite which helps balance oils throughout the day and tackle any sweat - perfect for warm Summer days - and with hyaluronic acid too it helps keep skin hydrated. Personally, the best thing I’ve noticed after a week’s use is that my fine lines aren't as noticeable, so I’m quite pleased with that! It really looks beautiful on and has a texture unlike anything I’ve sampled before! Really lightweight and gives a soft glow to the skin. It comes with a small dispenser, although I find applying with fingers allows for a quicker application and it seems to blend better. I admit I have also used this under a foundation as a primer and it provided the perfect base. With 14 different shades available, catering to a mix of skin tones, there’s a nice selection to choose from. If you’re looking for a natural matte look while keeping it lightweight, I recommend giving this a try.   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. reviews.review_title: A patchy disaster for my skin, gave it a fair try
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Too much hype for a product that’s mediocre — or, at best, not any better than other “blurring” product. I’m mid-fifties and have oily skin and pores that I would love to make less obvious with a product like this, and I tried a little on the back of my hand in-store and was impressed with how smooth and dry it felt afterwards, so I bought the Universal “shade”. Well I am pretty good with my makeup application skills after forty years at it and love playing with new makeup, but no matter what I tried I have just not been able to make this work for me! I tried it under my liquid foundation(s) (I have a number of different ones), over my foundation (like a powder”), and mixed with my foundation. I have used another primer underneath, or skipped it. I have applied with my fingers (patting it), with a stippling motion with a flat top brush, and with my beauty blender. No success no matter what — because no matter how it’s applied, my skin looks patchy and my makeup starts breaking up after just a couple of hours. It’s a disaster by the end of an eight hour day! And any colour cosmetics used along with it (liquid or powder blushes and/or bronzer) start to change colour along with breaking up. Although my skin may not look as oily, with all the patchiness I only look good and my skin “blurred” if you stand farther away where you can’t see the surface very clearly. I frankly feel embarrassed walking around like that. By the end of the day, I can literally “feel” it heavy on my skin and can’t wait to wash it off as soon as I can. I don’t have any of those experiences at all with my usual routines. I frequently get compliments on how nice my skin looks with my foundations even! I have been using Tatcha’s solid primer for the past several months and I find it at times can make my skin look a little bit too shiny by mid-morning, and I expected this to be similar but without the shine. Nope. I’m going back to Tatcha thru the colder months and my Milk Hydrogrip alone the rest of

I cannot possibly live without this product in my makeup routine, and I don't think you should either. The difference in makes oil control wise is truly astounding.

It can cling to texture a bit and you’ll notice it up close of course but the distance read is beautiful. Highly recommend for oily girls. Combine it with a pigmented balm and you’re in business.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received a generous sized sample container of this from Sephora, and received another in a Sephora Favorites set. When those are gone I will be purchasing the full size.   I love the blurring effect and how it makes very fine lines disappear. Wearing it under makeup is not the only option. It can be worn alone and can even be swiped over makeup in specific areas when you don’t want to use it as a full face primer but you just want to take advantage of the blurring effect in specific areas. This is a handy way to use it if you want to control shine. It easily glides over makeup to blur without messing it up!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I love this but it is different from traditional foundations. I am a 50+ y/o with oily/combo skin. I use the lightest shade as a foundation, and I am a very pale person and it is a good color. I usually apply over sunscreen and it does well if the sunscreen has soaked in. The key is to make sure moisturizer and sunscreen have soaked in and then apply in LIGHT layers. Next I use a small amount concealer in some areas and then I powder the t-zone and undereye lightly. It doesn't cover everything, it's more a light coverage/ skin tint look, but at my age that's what I want. Most importantly, it evens out my skin, makes my pores hard to see, makes texture less noticeable, and keeps oil at bay. I hope DM continues to make it!

reviews.review_title: For my people with dry skin:
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product works very well, but you HAVE to follow Danessa's recommendations. She created the product, so she knows how it works lol. Your skin must be properly moisturized before applying this balm. After using my regular skincare products, including sunscreen, I apply Danessa's beauty oil with gold leaf and follow up with her yummy skin glow. I don't think you need to use these products, I just like using products from the same brand. If you don't care for this, just make sure your skin is moisturized. Anyway, after moisturizing my skin, my face is PREPPED for the balm. This balm can be applied with fingers, a sponge, or a brush. I prefer to use a dense brush because I feel that this gives the best coverage. The finish is very natural, a my skin but better kind of vibe. It actually gets better as the day progresses - no touch ups needed. It can be used as a foundation and paired with concealers, bronzers/contours, and blushes in order to do a full face. If you're in a rush in the mornings, as I am most of the time, I wear it all alone. It self-sets, so I never use a powder or even a setting spray. I use my brush to put it on and I leave the house. I have a mirror at my work desk that I keep just to check on my makeup because certain brands have just done me so wrong. Now, I cannot stop looking at this mirror while I'm at work because I just can't believe how good this product looks on me. I'm afraid my coworkers think I'm vain, but I don't care lol. I hope Danessa never discontinues this product. I've been wearing makeup for a very long time and I even stopped for a bit because other brands either irritated my skin, oxidized horribly, or simply didn't deliver what was promised. I've wasted a lot of money throughout the years and I can say for sure: this product was a great investment. Absolute 10/10!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to like this product but it is a NO for me! I applied it twice. The color was off even though I went into Sephora to color match and that matched me for an even lighter tone, 3.5…I bought a 5! Very drying to my skin.

I’ve used this on a friend who is a shade lighter than me, and my mom who is a shade darker than me and this product still works like magic!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have normal skin and so did not encounter any of the concerns about finish or dry texture enhancement that are frequently mentioned regarding this product.  My beef is with the monotony of the undertone options.  I tried shades 1, 3, and 3.5 searching for something really neutral because even though my skin is cool toned, I can usually wear a neutral foundation just fine.  For me, neutral means light tan without excessive warmth or coolness.  The only difference between 1, 3, and 3.5 is the intensity of the yellowish-orange undertone.  So far as I can tell, there is no option in this product that is actually TAN or cool toned.  I can make this product work by applying directly over my glowy sunscreen where the whiteness of the zinc oxide tones down the orangeness, and then I modify the tone with a true brown or rose-toned bronzer but that kind of defeats the ease of use and adds a hassle factor.  (BTW, the Groundwork palette has the same deficiency - too much orange and yellow tone in the shade selections.)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I don't have big pores but this product sank into them and made them so noticeable. It was really not great on my skin. It also clung onto all my dry flakes that I did not notice before using it. Not for me.

Unfortunately for me, it did not work at all on my skin. Buyer beware: if you have even slightly dry skin, this product will cling onto every single piece of flaky skin and enhance it tenfold.

reviews.review_title: The only foundation I’ll ever use!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation is so lightweight, silky and skin perfecting. I’ve never ever had anything control my oil so well. It’s ruined me for all other foundations, simply the best!

reviews.review_text: This is more of a very light tinted moisturizer. I have pretty clear skin with minimal marks. It kind of went on like lotion but didnt really make a difference in my skins appearance.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted so bad to support this BOB and had high hopes from the helpful sales associate. Unfortunately on my two attempts of wearing the foundation my face was left looking dry with a grayish tone. It’s possible I don’t have the right skin type for the product because I felt the color match was pretty natural and spot on. However, not even serum, moisturizer, primer, or dewy setting spray could help my finalize look.

reviews.review_title: Holy Grail for Oily Skin No Makeup Makeup
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is my new holy grail. My if you were stranded on an island what product would you take?. As someone with oily skin but wants to embrace the no-makeup-makeup look, it has been difficult to find a product that is light and sheer enough, does not make me look like an oily chicken by the end of the day, and does not require a lot of powder (thus losing the dewy look). This product did all of that for me. I think of it as the Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood Flawless Filter for people with oily skin. It has a natural coverage (is buildable though) and doesn't make me oily. For a more full coverage look, I add some of the Nars concealer, but most days, I just wear some Yummy Skin for the natural look. I use the spatula to scoop the product, then I use my fingers to dab it on the spots I want, blending with a Beauty Blender. It lays very well on the skin. I do use a heavier moisturizer when I use this product, though, because the oil wicking is so good, I notice my skin looks a little dry. Completely opposite problem than I'm used to, so it doesn't bother me much. If you have dry skin, I can see how this would bother you, though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Feels nice on the face but makes my foundation break apart right away. This is silicone based and my foundation is also silicone based, so they SHOULD work well together. Might work better if I just use this with bare face and concealer

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I'm not sure if it does much. But I have very dry skin, and it hasn't done any harm. lol It's very difficult to apply with a brush as the brush will absorb the product and get heavy/greasy, so I apply with my fingers in a patting motion. It has a very strong chemical odor (think off brand petroleum jelly, but stronger). So it is a little off-putting. I will keep using it, but will probably not repurchase. I tried it as an eye liner/shadow primer with the Danessa Myricks liquid pigment and it did not help at all either.

reviews.review_title: Great for others, but not my mature skin.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Age 53 Mature oily/combo skin with large pores, texture and fine lines: I truly wanted to love this product and was extremely excited to purchase it, but after spending two months trying to get it to work for me, I'm left feeling disappointed. I cannot use it at all on its own and look good as it settles to look 'broken' in appearance and quite obvious. While it does work halfway decently as a primer on some parts of my face (and that's how I mainly use it since I don't want the product to go to waste), I find that it results in polka dot pores on my nose where my pores are largest, and makes my undereye area look incredibly dry and cakey, so I mainly use it on the rest of my T-zone and cheeks. I devote a lot of time to skincare and skin prep, and have figured out which products work best with this balm powder for the most flattering results, but I can honestly say I believe there are better products out there for more mature skin. Mature women with smaller pores and less oily skin may love it, and definitely younger skin may look great with it, but it just doesn't work great for my skin and skin type.   As a side note, if I apply it to my lips, I noticed that my lip products last MUCH longer with zero tendency to bleed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, gray hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After using for several weeks, it has made a positive difference in my combo/oily skin! I love it and will continue to use daily. I’m even buying a second one now, I love it so much! Don’t hold back, get one!

It took me a bit to figure this product out, but once I did — it workd so incredibly well. The way I use it is to scoop a fair bit out (maybe two peas worth) and massage all over my face and then do my makeup as regular. And oh. my. goodness. It really absorbs the oils or something. All I know is that it looks fantastic, doesnt feel heavy at all, and my makeup actually LASTS all day long, even on my 10+ hour workdays!

It works well with cream or powdered blush and bronzer. The upsalite technology is amazing for absorbing oil throughout the day, considering that I usually get oily in my T-zone.

reviews.review_title: Perfect on its own / Repurchased 3 times
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is one of the most unique base products I have ever come across. I LOVE this blurring balm powder. The texture is great and this product works perfectly on its own - I use it to quickly even out my complexion. It does not need to be set with powder and I do not need any smoothing primers if I wear this. I have an olive undertone, so in summer Shade 4 works best for me. For fall/winter I have been mixing Shade 3 and Shade 4 because 3 is way too light on its own. But I recently saw they added new shades and want to try Shade 3.5 because it may be a good match. I typically have oily skin, but in fall and winter my skin gets very dry. This blurring balm looks so natural and flawless after my skin prep. I wear this to the gym and absolutely love it - I can sweat and my skin still looks like skin, and it does not break me out. I do not use this when I wear foundation or a full face of makeup. I have repurchased this 3x now and can't wait to see what other innovative products Danessa Myricks creates!

reviews.review_title: HOLY GRAIL Product for oily, textured skin!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Blurring Balm Powder is one of my HOLY GRAIL complexion products. I have oily, textured aging skin with rosacea on my cheeks & chin. I am shade 5 which is perfect for my medium/tan warm olive skin tone. I use this almost every day as a light foundation...it covers enough of my redness and blemishes to even out my skin. When I have more time, I use the balm powder as a primer and it is glorious. It blurs and controls my oil & texture, and my foundations go on beautifully. I've also used the balm powder with just powder on top, for a light natural look. It really does control my oil all day, without drying down my skin. When I'm paler in winter, I can also use Shade 4. My favorite way to use this is not with the scope or beauty blender, but my foundation brush like the BK Beauty 101 brush and stipple it onto my face for a light layer. A little goes a long way, so don't put too much or it could get cakey. This formula is genius with the upsalite and Danessa Myricks is an innovative artist with this hero product. I've already panned one, and that is saying a lot since I have a big makeup collection. This balm powder is always on my vanity as a daily use product. Highly recommend. This is my FAVORITE product from her entire make up line! MUST HAVE! I've reviewed this on my YT channel @MikiCarrBeauty as my top products of 2022!

It didn’t pill at all through the day, just as I took it off. I’m not sure what to make of this but I still enjoy the product!
