The spoon application tool is actually pretty handy and makes the balm pretty easy to use. I would definitely recommend this cause not only is it great, but it’s so quick and efficient to apply. You can honestly just dab blend with your hands and call it a day.  It’s advertised as mattifying and I have combo skin that’s mainly normal, the blurring powder didn’t mattify at all. If anything, it gave me a glow but personally I love a glow.

reviews.review_title: This powder balm does it for me!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This blurring balm is a great primer to fill and blur pores also helps maintain the shine. I have combo/oily skin and this has actually kept my makeup on!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am in love with this product. The smell of it is very calming and just blends so well! I use a tightly packed brush to apply and pat it onto face. I don’t streak it around since I found this to cause it to apply weirdly. After this I pat it in with a dry sponge and it’s amazing. It sticks well throughout hot weather, and wear this almost everyday!

reviews.review_title: THIS UNIQUE FORMULA LIVES UP TO ITS CLAIMS
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: overall, if you can master the learning curve BUY THIS ASAP!   to use, you MUST MUST MUST prep your skin correctly. i gently rub my face with micellar water on a cotton pad, moisturize, then prime, and let’s all of that SIT for a couple minutes. and the way to apply this is with your fingers or a loosely packed foundation brush. you WON’T like the way this looks when you first apply it, but the product will melt into your skin. for reference, i have combination skin and have little to no acne, but i’m a sweaty mess in the summer.   also, the shade range is limited so if you’re questioning your shade go with the next shade up or get the translucent shade as a primer!   this formula is so unique! this feels lightweight on the skin and holds up amazingly against sweat and oils! and when you set it with powder, you will be good to go all day! THIS IS MY NEW FAVORITE AND I WILL BE A FAN FOREVER!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve used this under foundation, over foundation, and on its own. It will highlight any dry patches of skin and also look greasy within minutes of application. How does something look dry and greasy at the same time ? I wanted to love this product but can’t. It’s very slippery in feel , very sheer coverage.  I wanted to use this on no makeup days but it doesn’t do anything to control shine

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have very weird fussy skin that will get quite oily but is intensely dehydration-prone and tends towards LOOKING dry despite being oily. This product is GREAT for that. I use it on no or minimal-makeup days to keep my oils down and blur my pores a bit - it makes a huge difference on my nose especially. It is pricey but you don't have to use very much; I mainly use it in my T-zone as a standalone oil controller or a primer. It really helps balance my skin, which tends to look pretty awful with any kind of setting powder no matter what and avoid that greasy but somehow also dry/cakey look I often struggle with avoiding. Anything really matte looks bad on my skin even with good prep, but anything too skinlike usually winds up just not tolerating my oils well and this does substantially help with that.  I will say, I don't think that I'm actually the oiliest person out there and I WAS expecting more oil control than it actually gives. I don't want to discount what it does - it really does help in a way that's much more elegant on my skin than a powder or matte products, and it helps enough that I will likely repurchase even for the price, but it's not the oil-absorbing miracle I was hoping for. I do still need to powder through the day, but less so which looks much nicer on me. Also, the packaging is lovely and very sturdy/robust - I just wish it was refillable! It's not a ton of product in there so I really wish it was possible to buy a replacement pan and not have to toss the whole thing. It feels so wasteful to have to get rid of the whole big component. I've also noticed the product can be a bit funny about pilling if I try to apply over certain skincare or blend certain products over it.

reviews.review_title: i tried and it ends up patchy 95% of the time
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have tried and tried and cannot get this to work for me. It consistently separates. I’ve watched influencers rave, which is why I purchased, and yet I cannot figure out how to make it work. I’ve ended up embarrassed at BBQs too many times now. The instructions are so vague and unhelpful. Maybe a video would be helpful? Regardless, in my opinion, it’s too much effort to understand and too unpredictable to bother.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Pros: I have combo skin, and this works VERY WELL in keeping my T-zone matte THE WHOLE DAY. I used to use the Laura M setting powder, but I find that I need to retouch my T-zone every hour. But this product makes me forget that I even have combo skin! The texture is very unique, and it does take some getting used to. I use a small amount (there’s a reason for that), apply on my T-zone, spread it outwards using my fingers, and then try to blend it out with a sponge.  Cons: Maybe it’s because it used a tinted balm, but it clings on to dry patches and doesn’t blend well!! I don’t have a lot of texture, I moisturize religiously, I prep my skin (primer and all), and I don’t use a lot of product, but I can’t seem to figure out why it would look patchy and it won’t blend no matter how much I try. I’ve tried applying it with a brush, but that almost looks worse. You don’t really notice it unless you look very closely, but it bothers me that it doesn’t give me the same seamless look as a setting powder would have.  Last thoughts: I think the patchiness issue is mainly because it’s tinted, so I went ahead and bought the translucent version to try. I’m really hoping that that fixes it. I also don’t use it as a foundation, but more as an oil-control product. I’m genuinely surprised that it works for my oily forehead and I really love the product for that, now I just have to figure out how to make it look not patchy (and I’m hoping the translucent balm will solve it)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I bought two of these shades. One in shade 2 and another in translucent, I was skeptical until I saw Rose (instagrammer: Roseandben) use it and it looked soo good on her. Unfortunately on me, it was a dry, cakey mess. This kept gathering in certain areas, I tried so hard to make it work with different primers or using different methods, it just didn’t work so I had to return. The universal shade isn’t worth the price, you can find something similar for way less $.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I use this product very lightly as a base over my cheeks and T zone. Works wonders keeping my skin looking matte but not dry. This product gets better as the day goes on. This is my go to for light makeup days !

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Absolutely my favorite foundation! The texture is interesting at first but it lasts so long and it’s interesting how it almost beads out sweat it doesn’t mix with the foundation. I’ve recommended it to two other people and they have also enjoyed it. Definitely medium coverage and it feels like nothing on the skin. I’m thinking of getting it in my concealer and bronzer shade as well!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Keeps me matte and blurred all day. I use it and then spot conceal and finish with powder for a no makeup makeup look. Amazing for oily skin even after you blot your face. Has the perfect amount of tint

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I thought this would be the perfect product to cover acne scars or to do a light coverage for those no makeup kind of days, this sat of top of my skin and would not blend no matter what primer, moisturizer or nothing at all. I’m returning this asap

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Amazing product if you have oily skin and want a no makeup, makeup look. I apply it all over and then use concealer to spot conceal, followed by powder. Keep your face matte and blurred for almost the entire day. I blot my face and it still looks amazing and smooth.

reviews.review_title: Finally… No make up make-up for oily skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product is meant for those with low coverage preference. As an Oily AF skin type, I haven’t found any light coverage foundation that is suited for oily skin until this product! I love my freckles and this is letting me show them off without my oils coming through. This product is nothing I’ve ever tried and I hope it stays around for a long time. It’s best used with fingers. Scent is pleasant.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Absolutely obsessed with this product. Danessa knocked it out the park!  My daughter and I wore this to Atlanta for 5 days in extreme heat and humidity.  This balm kept the oils at bay for more than 7+ hours. At the end of the day, our makeup still looked great! For reference: my daughter is 25 with combo sensitive skin and uses the color 7. I am 48 with combo skin and use the color 5.  I highly recommend!

reviews.review_title: Must have for an oily complexion, especially 40's
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Amazing product for a fresh and natural look! I'm 44 with oily yet clear skin. Luckily I don't have fine lines so this product was earth shattering to me! It evens out my skintone without looking like a traditional foundation! I simply apply iver spf 50 and I look fresh and natural.  I like barely there coverage as I do have nice skin, I enjoy the pore blurring effect and evening out my skintone.  I pair this with the DM cream contour and DM cream blush, it's absolutely stunning! I get so many compliments on my complexion and healthy glow from the contour and blush, the best makeup purchases I have ever made. I'm DM for life and her products don't break the bank!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: It’s like magic. I love this stuff. I have always had oily skin and was skeptical when I bought this. But this is the best product I have ever used to keep my greasiness under control. I will be buying in more colors.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to like this but it stinks. Literally. I couldn’t place it at first. I thought it was the beauty blender, but it’s the product. I cant exactly place it but it sorta smells like Raid Roach Spray which I don’t really want on my face.  Aside from that, the product is interesting but heavy. It settles into my mouth lines after a while. The translucent doesn’t really mattify either.   I’ll stick to my traditional foundations and powder and set afterwards.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: perfect wear and matches my skin tone. I will buy again.

reviews.review_title: I can’t believe how well this balm works!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I swirled a brush in this balm and was astounded at how much product there was. I coated my entire face and neck with that one swirl. It still looked like too much so I used a beauty blender and it came out looking amazing! All day in serious heat and FL humidity it lasted. This balm has serious coverage and I can’t imagine wearing a foundation over it. For reference I have very dry, mature skin. I also use Ben Nye fixing spray which is heavy duty. I also use an illuminating setting spray before I applied this product which might’ve had more to do with how long it lasted than the product itself. I was able to blend my contour, bronzer and blush in  so perfectly with this balm. I was really surprised to look in the mirror 6 hrs later and it looked the same! It feels really lightweight too! I bought this on a whim and I’m so glad I did!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product is absolutely amazing! I don’t know what she put in this but it controlled the oil all day long. But when applying it make sure you wait at least 5 minutes before applying any foundation or powder let the product set in a little bit but yes definitely 5 out of 5 stars bravo :-)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I follow several famous makeup reviewer Utubers. This balm powder seemed to have good feedback so I took the plunge because I have old acne scar texture, some enlarged pores and discolouration. I thought this might offer a layer of blurring action for a more flawless face. The word powder is very misleading. It goes on like a wet oil like paste, it’s not thick mind you, but I did not find that it dries down at all to a powder finish. I needed actual powder to set it. Yes it offers a thin layer of cover up but you will still need to add a concealer on top to really cover up problem areas. I found it looks kind of flat on the face and not skin like -more mask like. I also have KVD good apple cream foundation in the compact. KVD covers better and kind of goes on in the same way if you use very little it spreads. But unlike the KVD I found this blurring balm powder just sat on top of my skin and looked cakey and smeared and became patchy as the day went by. My other foundations are way better as far as longevity and coverage. I used this under like a primer and over a very light foundation as well as under a foundation powder. Honestly, I looked worse with this. I don’t have oily skin I lean more normal/combo and I did not find this controlled oil in my T zone. It has a nice light texture on the skin and maybe on darker skin tones it won’t look so flat or obvious, but on my skin this made me look like I was wearing makeup and did nothing to blur anything. Just an extra cakey layer on me so I returned it. Has a weird chemical smell to it. 2 stars for great packaging with the spoon though!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I picked the wrong color which was my fault.  I should have picked 3 but bought 2 as I wasn't sure and picking colors online are hard.  It sat on my skin and it made my skin seem like it was dry as it clung to areas of my skin.  It didn't blend in.  On my chin and nose it seemed like it made my pores more visible.   It is one of the rare purchases that I have returned.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: i love dm beauty products but this just wasn't one. the texture, application, wear... everything about it was just a no. unsure how this worked on oily skin when this made me look like i applied vaseline all over my face.

reviews.review_title: Works wonders on those with oily skin!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have SUPER oily skin. Like, if you blotted the top of a Little Caesar’s pizza and compared it to whatever I may used to blot my face mid afternoon, you honestly probably wouldn’t see much of a difference. I’ve always felt like I needed a squeegee for my face. Anyway, I digress… I don’t know what kind of magic was used to create this balm, but it is AMAZING! My face stays matte while wearing this, with a little oil showing through maybe 9-10 hours in. Also, it’s super easy to apply and feels so light on the skin. This is great light coverage for those “no makeup” days, and I can see the Universal shade being great for anyone needing an oil-control base, or just oil control without anything on top. I highly recommend for any oily-skinned people like me!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I REALLY wanted to make this work but it’s a no from me. I tried it under, over and as my makeup. I also tried it alone and with a trusted primer. Each time I looked greasy and each time my makeup just slid right off my nose and forehead.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This has become my multi-purpose product for everyday use.  I really don't need anything else. I have Shade 3 and Universal, and I use them both the same way but not together, like I will use shade 3 one day and universal on another day.  But anyway, I will use as a primer, or mix into my liquid foundation, or set my foundation. And no matter how I use it the result is the same.  A beautiful soft matte.  I also use as an Under-eye primer, no creases (chef's kiss) and I also use as a lip primer by just putting it on the outline of my lips, no bleeding from my liner, glosses, or lipsticks. Although it doesn't work too well as an on-lid eye primer for me, because I have slightly hooded eyes and they get oily.  So I stick with my Smashbox eye primer. Overall, this has become my EVERYTHING to my base makeup. I will definitely repurchase both again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have incredibly oily skin and am frequently disappointed in primers. This looks great under my foundation and prevents me from getting super oily throughout the day. I used to have to blot a few hours into wearing foundation, but with this product used as a primer I can go as long as 8 hours without needing to blot at all, and even when I blot at the 8 hour mark there are barely any oils to soak up. I'm really impressed with this product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I tried this balm powder the night I got it just after I washed my face and it did not look good at all it looked like I had clown makeup on so I was going to send it back. I decided to try it again a couple days later after using my moisturizer and primer and using my fingers as others recommended and WOW!! The color was perfect and I used it lightly as others recommended and it blended perfectly. I used it under my eyes and there was no cakieness to it, I used on the rest of my face and it blended nicely. I Love this stuff! This container will last a long time and the price is way cheaper then the foundation I bought. The key was using a little bit and blending with fingers.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have balanced to oily skin and this product made my skin look DRY and enhanced every single pore. It never sunk into my skin and was clear I had makeup on all day - like cake face level. I usually go for a really natural look so ended up returning.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I use it for the extra coverage that my foundation does not provide! I love it!  I am using the Yummy Skin Serum Foundation in 9N and it works well with my neutral medium light tan skin.  I have light melasma (hyperpigmentation) on my upper cheekbones that the Yummy Serum Foundation does not cover.  I decided to try the Yummy Powder Balm in 4 as my powder concealer.  I would say the balm powder has more of a brightening effect and it is a teenie teenie bit lighter then the 9N serum.  It's the perfect color and with the brightening effect it looks really nice on my upper cheekbones.  I use a dense flat top kabuki brush and use patting motions to get the full coverage from the balm and only use it on my upper cheekbones (over the hyperpigmentation and Yummy Serum). I use a dry beauty sponge to push in the balm that's on my cheekbones.  When I do this I go from an oily look to more of a satin your skin but better look.  The dry sponge absorbs and lifts the oily look from the balm but does not remove my coverage. I use a cream blush from Melt and use a flat kabuki brush to pat it onto my cheekbone.  I find setting the balm with powder makes me look I have thick foundation on so i never use powder on my cheek area or under my eyes but I do powder everywhere else with the Charlotte Tillsbury powder (compact) in the color medium.  I have the glow without the greasy oily look.  I use Pat Mcgrath Skin Fetish LM14 under my eyes.  It's so hard for me to find full coverage foundation or concealers that do the job without the look of heavy makeup, but I have found it with this combo.  Danessa is working for me.  I'm sold!  I find doing a last blotting of enter face with a paper towel removes the excess, and as the hours go on I wont have to blot so soon if I do this right before walking out the door.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have an oily skin type and normally I have to significantly powder my face to keep makeup on. Not with this! The more oily and sweaty I get the better my skin looks! Worth every penny.

reviews.review_title: If you’re a match, snatch this up NOW!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My makeup has never looked better than when I use the blurring powder as a base. I have combo skin with oily t-zones. I usually have to blot a few times throughout the day. I wore the blurring balm powder for  14 hours straight and didn’t blot once! This plays so nicely with my other products, and reapplying sunscreen is not an issue.  The best part of this product is that it gets better with time! Your skin looks so good hours in compared to other products that oxidize or break down. No issues here.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have oily skin and this keeps my oils at bay better than any complexion product I've ever used! There isn't anything that would control my oils for more than 3 hours, but this keeps me looking good for 8 hours! I enjoy using this all over my face for very light coverage, along with concealer. I don't need to set it and I need to set everything!

reviews.review_title: Nice coverage but not for large pores
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Blended beautifully and gave very nice coverage, but no matter what skin prep I used before putting this on, this just sat in my pores. I could see it in my pores, even if I used a pores filling primer beforehand. So if you have larger pores, maybe pick something else.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product has pretty good coverage, but as a person with normal to dry skin, it clung to all my texture and dry spots. I think this would work pretty well for someone with oily skin, though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Having oily skin and living in the south I’ve always had issues with my foundation sticking and staying.  I just got this and decided to play around with it, I only wore it inside for a couple of hours and immediately was impressed.  I saw my foundation actually stuck to my nose.  And my foundation STAYED. And I didn’t have to use any powder or setting spray.

reviews.review_title: Dry skin…and shocked that this worked
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I purchased this in the middle of the Arizona summer while experiencing the hot-flash joys of perimenopause. I normally have dry skin, but with the added heat I sweat intermittently and my foundation runs everywhere. But this stuff is insane at keeping my face dry! I only need the coverage this can provide on its own, so I can’t say how it does with foundation, but wow how it kept my skin mattified! It was almost too mattified so I spritzed on a glowy setting spray that added just a touch of glow, and wow. I honestly thought this wouldn’t work for me based on other reviews. If you have drier skin like mine and are in a hot climate, give this a try anyway and you might be pleasantly surprised like I was!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to like this so bad! It disappointed, to say the least. I have oily skin and this somehow made me look dry. The color matching was difficult, one was too light and the other was too dark.

reviews.review_title: holy grail primer for oily skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely adore this product. It has exceeded my expectations in so many ways. I have very, very oily skin with large pores, and I live in a hot and humid climate. I have used this as a primer under several liquid foundations and it is a miracle product for me. Keeps oils at bay, increases the longevity of my foundation, and enhances coverage of foundation. I apply it with a brush then use a Beauty Blender to apply my foundation and I've been blown away by the results. Seriously, I have never had any primer work nearly as well on my skin as this one has.

reviews.review_title: Definitely a love it or hate it product !
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is my 2nd try but I have the translucent this time (the 1st try was in shade 4) I repurchased in translucent thinking I might have better luck :( I REALLY wanted this to work & to love it. Initially I was SURE I was going to after reading, researching the product & reviews, it SEEMED to be something comparable to a product I love/use everyday already - Nudies Tinted Blur Sticks by Nudestix - bcz they’re just so easy to apply/blend; they’re forgiving, versatile & blurring. I love them esp when I’m tan. So I kinda went into this thinking they’d offer similar blurring/coverage qualities. But this works nothing like the Nudestix - at least not on my skin.  If you have pores, lines, dry patches, even if you have peach fuzz on the surface of your skin - BEWARE!! - bcz it WILL accentuate ALL OF IT - which is the total OPPOSITE effect of what the Nudestix do for me. I felt like this product accentuated/magnified stuff I couldn’t even see before application. It actually “pools” & sits in pores, it “catches” on any dry patches you may have & it certainly doesn’t blend in & become 1 w/the skin - it sits on top & my GOODNESS it is VERY OBVIOUS. The formula feels like a very slippy, greasy formula & once it’s on, it looks like it’s been sitting on the skin for hours bcz it also looks like it’s separating & breaking down (similar to how a medium to full coverage foundation looks after hours of wear & oil production breakdown) — I don’t know how else to describe it. I don’t think I’ve ever had a product behave or look this way on me before.  Sadly, I can’t even “make it work” but I am seeing people who are loving it & it appears to work well on a VERY PARTICULAR type of skin - no peach fuzz, no pores or texture - just very plump/smooth, texture-free (basically perfect) skin. Should that ever change for those people, there’s another product out there they can try - the Nudestix :) Personally & I’ll stick w those.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love love love this balm! I use it as my foundation base & it just wears so nicely throughout the day! Perfect for those who are looking for a summer foundation, since its light-weight & stays put! But also for those who do a whole beat, I wore this with a full routine & it still looked gorgeous. I get so many compliments when wearing this! I have more combo/dry skin & its just perfect for more dry skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I use this as a face primer on my oily t zone and it keeps it matte throughout the day, which is perfect. My skin is combo mostly dry. The only downside is that it does not work well underneath all the foundations I own but it is a good product though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I watched a few YouTube reviews before I tried it and found that applying first with fingers then using a beauty blender worked perfectly. I agree with other reviewers that this does require some trial and error but it IS an incredible product. I have combo skin and used this in my oily areas (chin mostly) and then used another product on my cheeks and forehead worked best for me. I experienced no flaking or break up even over sunscreen. You truly don’t need much; a little goes a very long way and you get a lot for the price I think. This is going to last a while! Very happy with my purchase.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have SUPER oily skin and enlarged pores. When I saw some of my favorite beauty influencers use this and love it, I bought it. I WISH IT CAME IN A MINI because you don't need a lot. AND...it does not sit well under liquid foundation. I accidentally threw away the box so I am stuck with it. It doesn't really do anything for oil control and my pores still looked the same size, so no blurring. Just not impressed.

reviews.review_title: Universal Shade is my New HG Primer
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My new HG, I used it as a primer under my foundation in my T Zone and I stayed MATTE all day, I was sweating near my hairline but no moisture sneaked through my face at all. I am sold on this product, I’ll probably keep using the universal as a primer especially for the hot summer months.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: so far I have enjoyed this on my skin blends beautifully and has good coverage. I think this would be excellent on others with dry skin and I can’t wait to try more of her products.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The reviews here were scaring me off, but I decided to give this product a try and I’m so happy that I did! I mean, look how smooth my skin looks like! No filter, no edit! I need to mention that I have dry skin, so I had skin prep beforehand: 111Skin moisturizer and Supergoop Sunscreen.  I’ve been getting compliments all day today!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Oily skin. Love this for my t-zone. Super versatile. Primer, foundation, powder. Can mix with other products. Just excellent all around for oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Shocked. Literally shocked and there’s no other way to describe this other than cutting edge. I’m extremely oily. I normally blot twice before I leave the house and every hour after that. I have had this balm powder on for 3 hours and have not blotted.  I initially used it as a primer with a smidge of KVD Lock It since the balm is super light coverage.  It played well with my foundation and looked good after applying. A couple hours later, I tapped this over my known oily spots just in case. Overall, I believe this balm kept my makeup intact in sweltering Texas heat and controlled my oil beyond belief. I suggest playing around with it to see what works best for you. It’s versatile and can used in multiple ways.

reviews.review_title: BEWARE IF YOU HAVE PORES, TEXTURE OR LINES!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product just isn’t good. It pools in my pores, it sits on top of my skin & doesn’t become one with it. Its super greasy & accentuates every little detail - even stuff I don’t normally see! I thought this was going to be more like the Nudestix tinted blur sticks with a more mattifying effect or blurred finish. But no, it’s just terrible on me. It makes absolutely no difference how I apply it, what I apply it with or how I prep my skin. If I had to describe what it’s like, it’s like trying to blend a slippery greasy tinted cream over driveway gravel. My skin has never been compared to driveway gravel until I tried this. Id say a person needs to have VERY smooth, plump, texture-free (basically perfect) skin with no texture or pores if this is going to look nice. But even then, I just wonder how it can blend & blur if it accentuates stuff that doesn’t even show up otherwise! I’m so sad about this bcz I was SURE it was going to be at least a similar (but hopefully better) version of the Nudestix but I was so wrong. I use my Nudestix everyday in the summertime too - I’ll stick with those. This is a hard pass. I’d include a photo but I’m hoping it’s not necessary after the description I gave.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I do like this product however there were some set backs 1) on its own it settled into fine lines and pores and made my skin look dry towards the end of the day  But because of my love for Danessa I decided to play a little bit more And try my best with it. I tired it with a couple different foundations and found the best formula was using it on top of my Nars tinted moisturizer, if it wasn’t for that I would have returned it. I wouldn’t purchase again, I have combination skin if that helps wouldn’t recommend if your skin is combo or dry

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: KEEP READING TO THE 2ND PART. So you have to play around with this product and figure out how it works best for your skin type in terms of what step to use it for in your application process. I have super , extremely uncontrollable oily skin it starts coming out before I'm even done with my makeup . Now I used this as recommended- a base before foundation. My skin lasted longer than usual,  2.5 hrs then I started to see the oil coming thru strongly so that was disappointing but I know stopping oils is almost impossible......NOWW...I got home and just dabbed some extra on my t-zone. It mattified and I went to lay outside for 2 hrs in the blazing heat, sweat was dripping down my arms , elbows , knees, neck. I was roasting I came inside...... and my face was completely matte. ...and the part that shocked me the most is that you can see where the sweat begins (where there was the least product near my scalp that I didn't touch up, and under my nostril where I missed ) LARGE BEADS OF SWEAT with a clear demarcation line. There is something to this stuff and if you can figure out how to work it either under or on top of your foundation or powders , setting or not setting it, some magic will happen . For that innovation I'm giving it 5 stars bc I've never seen any product do that in my life.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It’s just amazing. Allows me to put face oil on oily forehead (that needs it) and still look matte all day. Like through a nap. Skin looks poreless, under eye concealer has never looked better. I don’t like the packaging tbh, the spoon keeps falling off and I’d much prefer a hinged compact to a twist. But it’s definitely still worth it. As far as I can tell this is the only non-powder upsalite product available, and upsalite is a really exciting technology I’m very happy to support. Yay material science <3

reviews.review_title: had to make sure I wasn’t wearing a filter!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Rich skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As someone who religiously only wears concealer under the eyes, I will have to give this product an A+! My skin is combination but when I wear makeup I tend to get super oily and compromising the initial matte look I try to go for. Before i tried this i tried using very minimal matte foundations but I ended up just looking cakey and super greasy. This however, made me matte, kept me matte, gave me some coverage, and blurred to heck out of my skin! Even in this 100 degree Texas weather! I would definitely check this out if you want to maintain your makeup all summer!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: OMG, this product is amazing if you’re oily.  With this and juice boost, I blot my face only once at about 1pm.  For reference my makeup is on at 4am and off at 5pm.  Do the math!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to like this product, but it made my skin super oily. This product felt like Vaseline, I wanted it to dry down and it never did. I will be returning.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I read about this product and purchased it. Then I read the reviews and was worried that I would have to return it. But, I was very surprised with the product. I apply it with a brush, after primer. I find my pores are less noticeable, and my make up looks better with this on. I took off a star because of the scent. If you can get past that, I think it’s a good product.

reviews.review_title: Holy grail status for oily skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I had absolutely no intention of buying this. I ignored all the reviews that were popping up in my youtube feed. I usually don't believe many foundation claims about helping oily skin because, in the end, many of them perform the same way. However, when I read that this has an ingredient that I have never come across before that helps with oil production, I figured it might be worth the risk to try. My makeup usually starts to melt and oxidize in a few hours. Anyway, I will tell you now that this is officially holy grail status. On the first try, after a few hours, my skin looked matte/natural and my makeup didn't oxidize at all. After several hours my skin was a little dewier but still, my makeup looked really nice... no oxidizing and also no crepiness or separation. The next day I was excited to try products that I normally can't wear.. like cream blushes and highlighters... and it worked out better than I imagined. I basically feel like I have different skin.. I can even use more emollient moisturizers under my makeup. As for coverage... I got shade 5 and it is a good match for me ( Mac Nc44, fenty 330, estee lauder 4N2/4w2). I layer it on for light coverage with my fingers. I will try a sponge next time because I heard that it's even better. Anyway, if you are oily, I highly recommend trying this. It could change your makeup routine in a good way.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The packaging is really cute and the product it’s self is high quality! It sits well on my skin and minimizes the shininess. I did read a review previous before I bought the product and it mentioned a smell. If there is a smell u really have to sniff it to tell lol. I would just keep it in mind if u have a good sniffer or a sensitive one. It’s definitely not a intense smell tho

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I think this product is best for oily skin types. I have dry skin and I do like it, but I use it around my nose to blur and conceal redness. If I used it all over my face it would be too drying for me. I have the Fair/1 shade and it’s a good match, but I wish I’d ordered the translucent shade because of my fine lines.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: absolutely love this product! i use this as my foundation and i love that i can build up coverage and it doesn’t look cakey. i also really love that it’s self setting throughout the day and by the end of the day my skin isn’t oily like how it is with other foundations. i would say this is a great product for anyone who is balanced to oily.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve always had aggressively oily skin specifically with makeup. I’ve never been able to wear a full face all day bc it would never last. Blotting my face would always remove my makeup because I was so oily … until I used this product. I have been able to get my makeup to last 14 hours with this using it as a primer and have been able to finally start wearing foundation without fear of it rubbing off. Definitely going to go back and purchase the tinted versions. Absolutely amazing product

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I don’t really find that this blurs pores (I have gigantic ones though), but this is PHENOMENAL at keeping my oils at bay throughout the day. I love wearing this without and without makeup. It doesn’t seem to irritate my sensitive skin either which is a huge plus.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I was hopeful but skeptical. This stuff is amazing. I don’t even have to wear foundation over or under it. I just add some bronzer and blush. It airbrushes/blurs nicely. I love the texture transition from cream to powder too. I could prob even go up a shade for summer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: i was excited to try this product bc my tzone gets so oily throughout the day. i tried as a primer at first but it wasnt the best. i saw some reviews say it works better over foundation so used my fingers to tap it over oily spots. it worked really well for shine control/pore coverage but definitely made my makeup kind of patchy, lifted product easier, and clung to dry spots where i had a pimple or something. maybe i shouldve used a setting powder under it? but also the point is to act like a powder so not sure but probably going to return.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this product! It can be used so many different ways and it can definitely be a trial and error process in figuring out how it works best for you. To use as a primer it definitely works best applied with your fingers but I personally love using it for all over coverage as a light foundation and for that, a brush definitely applies it best! It’s so beautiful and skin-like. It lasts all day without budging at all even on the hottest days. I can’t stop using this, absolutely obsessed!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I really loved this. I have very oily skin in my Tzone and when it’s hot I looky super oily. I love that you don’t need much and it makes your skin look so nice. I only had to use blotting sheets once when I wore it for 9 hours. I absolutely love this product

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product! The texture is very special, when applied, it feels like a cream then when it dries it looks like a powder but still feel like a cream… The shade is a perfect match for me!

reviews.review_title: Unusual but best I've tried to control oil
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I rarely write reviews considering how many different foundations, BB creams, powders, and tinted moisturizers I've tried. This is unusual, but overall I really like it and will repurchase.  It feels lightweight, sinks into skin in a good way so it becomes undetectable, and actually looks like skin. It is a satin matte or natural look for me but I have combo skin with a very oily t-zone. I only use it on my t-zone and it really covers redness. I would usually choose the second lightest color but I'm glad I went for shade 3 because it is quite light and leans towards golden too even though it says neutral. It is definitely not orange on my skin. It does not oxidize and in fact looks a little lighter once it blends into skin. When you first apply, it feels a bit greasy but it dries down to a soft skin like finish and really keeps my t-zone from getting oily for hours but does not make it look dry or cakey which is often a problem with things that claim to control oil. I put it on at 6am on Friday. At 5pm I blotted my t-zone and reapplied and it still looked perfect at midnight. I have tried it with a bunch of different primers and over sunscreen and I find it works the best on just lightly moisturized skin. I would say the coverage is light to medium, but I'm using it mostly for a bit of redness and to hide large pores, which it does well.   I agree that it has an odd smell but if it works I can tolerate that. So far it has not broken me out. I have practically tried everything at all price points and I think this is the best there is since they discontinued my favorite - the original version of the Perricone MD no foundation foundation serum.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am in LOVE with this product. (Danessa please don’t ever discontinue it!) For my combo/oily (in the summer) skin, this is a dream come true! It does feel balmy and a bit “shiny” with initial application (I use the brush she suggests in her tutorial videos), but dries down to a nice natural matte finish and keeps it that way all day. I have had trouble in the past with foundation breaking down by the end of the day, esp when we wore masks for work. So for the two years of the pandemic, I wore mostly powder foundation. This product was a great transition back to wearing more coverage when some of the restrictions lifted. I have worn it under a mask and found it still had fairly decent coverage without breakdown. I’ve also used it to set over a CC cream for more coverage and am impressed. Look forward to using it all summer.  And shade 4 is a perfect match for my light medium tan skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I am a very shiny gal, and I love using this as a primer and setting my face with this. I apply with my fingers, but I’ve also tried a dense brush and that works as well! It does dry down into a powder, so just don’t rub it in too much. Let it dry before layering other products! Then when I set my face with it, i don’t use a ton, i heat it up between my fingers, and tap into the places I want to set. I follow the same procedure when I use as a primer. It’s worth a shot for oily peeps!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product! I got shade 5 which I thought would add summer warmth, but it was the perfect shade for me. You do need to set it, but I promise you I had a 15 hour say without redoing my makeup which never happens!!! It is the perfect foundation, long wearing and doesn’t oil up! Which is unprecedented!!! Definitely happy with this purchase oh and no flashback!!!! You’re color stays true and doesn’t ash up or get darker.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I ordered the shade 7 which was to dark. I like the idea maybe she needs a few more shades. I know it’s supposed to be flexible but the undertones is the problem. I may try shade 6 but i don’t know bc I actually need the undertones of shade 5 but I feel it maybe to light. This is only available online which makes it even harder to determine the correct shade.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I bought the universal shade to use as a primer under foundation and it is LIFE CHANGING!! I have incredibly oily skin and no matter what I do I have to blot/powder just a couple of hours after applying makeup. I put this under my foundation, wore my makeup for around 12 hours, and didn’t have to blot or powder even once. After working and running errands all day, my makeup looks like I just applied it. This is my new holy grail primer! Oily skin folks, run, don’t walk.

reviews.review_title: A Tinted Moisturizer Oily Gorls Can Use (FINALLY)
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My skin is very oily and breaks down foundations most times ESPECIALLY in the summer. First off this has a silicone serum texture. The color was perfect for me, in the winter I was using Laura Mercier tinted moisturizer (original formula, Mocha) which I can't use in the summer. I do the same routine no matter which foundation I use. I sometimes use a silicone-based primer if not just moisturizer, elf camo concealer, Patrick Stars' setting powder, then Ben Nye final seal mixed with Charlotte Tilbury setting spray. I put it on at 4 PM and took it off at 4 AM. I went to dinner, a hookah lounge and an underground club. I stayed own there for maybe 10 minutes because of the 100°+ of body heat. I never touched it up but I did blot one time at 12 AM out of habit but didn't need to. Honestly its a tinted moisturizer oily gorls can use.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As a combo skin girl, I use the Danessa Myricks Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder as a concealer and a setting powder. It gives me more coverage that way. Since this has a soft matte finish, I like to pair this up with dewier skin tints. I focus this product under my eyes and area that need more coverage. I don't find this too drying on my skin. I just had to use a very moisturizing base in order to use this. Overall, I really like this innovative item. It's not perfect for my skin type but I made it work. I really like the finish this gives me. I already am a big fan of the Yummy Skin line so I can't wait to see what other things Danessa is going to come out with.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Overall I like this foundation/beauty balm. I have dry skin and I did not notice it clung to my dry patches which made me really happy. I also did not notice that it settled into my fine lines which made me happy. Do not put it on top of your eyelids because it does slide around. I did set it with a powder and I’m not sure if that’s what caused it to break apart so bad but that was my biggest issue with this foundation is throughout the day it broke apart on my skin. It blends like a dream it is very skin like but I think it might take some time to figure out how to work with it

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: i have acne prone and very oily skin. i prefer to go out with a skin like finish, so i tend to use products like the yummy serum and flawless filter. however i do prefer oil control on my t-zone which is literally oily even immediately after i do my makeup, so that’s what drew me into this product.   there is 100% a learning curve with this product and honestly i almost returned it, but i really wanted to like this product. at first i tried it applying with a fluffy brush at the end of my makeup, but it had a terrible finish that really wasn’t for me. it was a demi matte finish that really emphasized the texture all over my face and i really didn’t like it. then i tried applying it to my face with my fingers and it didn’t seem like the product is concentrated enough on the face because i was still oily as usual after using this product. then i applied it with a sponge and had the idea of only using it on the t zone and under eyes at the end of my makeup and this was a winner for me!!! it’s important to roll the product on with the sponge instead of tapping. i feel like it gives a smoother finish. i set it with the charlotte tilbury pressed powder and a powder puff and WOW it seriously keeps the oil at bay for way longer and i also found that it improves the appearance and longevity of my concealer!  i also found it works AMAZING as an eye primer, coming from a girl with super oily lids and creasing eyeshadow no matter how i prep my lids.  i will say this product is not for everyone. personally i wouldn’t use this on areas that you want to maintain dewiness because this product will take it away and leave an unflattering texture. i feel that this product would not work on textured areas, hence why i keep this product more on the t-zone. i think if you set this product with the correct powder, you won’t have issues with emphasis of pores and texture on the t-zone! i wouldn’t recommend this as a foundation but i would recommend it for oil control :)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been trying to neutralize the oiliness/shine in my t-zone for many years with a million different products with poor results. I used this as a primer under a baked powder foundation and after a full day wear test in warm weather…I look like I just applied it. Crossing my fingers this isn’t a fluke..but so far this has been pretty great!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product is great for a person with a particular set of requirements. If you are a slightly oily or oily person and you are looking for something light to medium coverage, then this is absolutely the product for you and I recommend using it as a foundation/skin tint. My makeup applies perfectly over top of it and it controls oil throughout the day which is perfect for summer. Another tip-do not over apply this! You only need a little bit per application. Also, I recommend using your fingers to apply it. It warms it up and is the best at smoothing out the product. That said-I realize this may not be a product for everyone. I, for one, will not be able to use this in the winter time. Right now at the start of summer, it’s a staple product for me!

reviews.review_title: LOVE this! No odor issues or dryness for me.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product was amazing. I am a mom that works full time and I dont always have that much time for makeup. I can do a full face in less than 5 minutes with these. I have several shades and I love to use them to conceal, highlight, contour and bronze. I have no experienced any odor issues as per other comments and I am usually really sensitive. I also have dry skin and its worked really well for me. I used a foundation brush, fluffy brush and a beauty blender to apply. I dont use powder on top with the exception of blush and a soft shimmer. 10/10 for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this because I love the foundation so much and thought I would love this also. First the smell...what is that? It is truly awful. This stuff settles into my pores and actually broke me out. Weird stuff!

reviews.review_title: Smells like Halloween makeup, settled into pores
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I had high hopes, but overall quite disappointed. First off, the odor/smell of this product is horrible, it reminds me of Halloween cream makeup or the white cream paste cover used in theatre. The odor is strong, synthetic, and chemical-smelling. I tested this over several days, with different combinations of prep and application methods: alone, over a moisturizer, and overtop a primer, and several methods (fingers, Artis palm brush, sponge). I found using the dense palm brush provided the most even and consistent coverage. The product did not work well overtop of only a moisturizer, but applied and wore the same overtop of bare skin and a primer (Tatcha liquid canvas). Long story short, this did not wear well on my skin throughout the day. It was drying and would settle into pores, fine lines, and cling to dry skin patches. I returned this product. I have fair, and dry skin prone to redness.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Used this to prime and color correct and it works wonders for skin prep. I could also use it for a full face as it matches my skin tone perfectly. Highly recommend! I bought shade 8 and plan to get more soon!

reviews.review_title: if I could give it 0 stars
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: absolutely terrible broke me up and made my skin dry. Worst decision ever buying this product

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to like this, but it looked awful on my skin. I take good care of my skin too. I used it without primer the first time and it made me look sick. I tried again with primer and buffed it in thinking that would help. It settled into my fine lines, my pores looked huge, and the dry spots on my face were highlighted. I felt so self conscious after wearing it out one day. I send it back for a refund soon after.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Clings to dry spots even after moisturizing well. I recommend going up a shade because this seems to go on lighter than the color looks. Dry spots were more visible that way, too. It does have decent coverage for how thin the formula is. I think this product is for people with smaller pores, even texture, and well-balanced skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This gave me good light/medium coverage and felt weightless on my skin. I apply it with my fingers and blend it with a fluffy brush. It looks really natural on its own but I lightly dust some translucent powder over it to set it since I’m oily. I was impressed that it lasted a solid 6-7 hours without me having to blot. I was in between shades 7 and 8 and chose 7. (385 in Fenty) It’s good but just a tad too neutral leaning. It balances out just fine with bronzer though. Overall I really like it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Holy crap!  This thing is crazy good. I apply a primer before putting it on. (The Touch in Sol primer works for me).  I have a super oily forehead and nose. This thing kept it blotted all. day. long!  I also paired this with the Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood Flawless Filter….Amazing. I looked dewy,  not greasy. I’ve applied this with my fingers, a kabuki brush, the ELF putty primer brush, and the Rose and Ben C41 brush. All methods work if you do a LITTLE BIT at a time and blend.  And I hate to admit it, but the $35 Rose and Ben brush did work the best; but I personally don’t think it’s a necessity.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I purchased this without really knowing what it was, but as I love everything Danessa Myricks makes I figured it would be ok. When I received it, it took me a few days to play with it and figure it out. The best use I found is for an eye primer. It’s fabulous in that capacity!  I tried it by itself over my SPF and yes it does blur pores and even out skintone a bit, I still wouldn’t wear it by itself. I used it under makeup as a primer and that does look really nice, especially if you’re wearing a lighter foundation or tinted moisturizer. I’m not too sure about using this over foundation as sort of a spot treatment to add more coverage. It didn’t work well for me in that way. I’ll continue playing with it and I’m glad I purchased it, as there’s at least two ways I can use it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: used shade 5 sall over the face, 3 to highlight and 7 to contour. I can also used 6/4/8-9 since the shades are adjustable. feels as soft as a rose petal and watching it transform from cream to powder is amazing. definitely great for oily skin, but as someone with normal skin using a hydrating primer/moisturizer like the yummy serum can def help you achieve the balance you need. an absolute game changed and I definitely recommend

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I looked dead after using this. By the end of the day, it had dried my skin out so badly, I looked like I had face planted in a pile of sawdust.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Revolutionary.  I don’t understand why this isn’t sold out. The makeup world should be shook. This product for oily skin is LIFE CHANGING…. ICONIC. This woman needs an award. There is so much of the same same being released, there’s nothing like this. I’m about to buy my third as a backup to my backup. Shout out to Glam Girl Chelsea who gave this the love it deserves. ICONIC.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Love this product so far. I have oily skin with visible pores and some blemishes and the balm took care of all of the issues. I worked out and it stayed put and matte. The color match is perfect. I'm hoping number 8 will work for me in the winter. I recommend for anyone with oily patches Or blemish prone skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Long lasting. Easily gets build up in oily areas however

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Not impressed. Hard to use. Makes my makeup look cakey. Did not see improvement in makeup appearance.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: …This stuff is AMAZING!! I have never used a product that controls oil in my t-zone. And I mean NEVER…EVER. I would get some control for a couple hours but would always have to follow up with blotting papers. But this balm to powder formula is FANTASTIC at oil control and blurring. Also helps my base products last all day. As a woman of color I decided to go with the neutral shade and I’m so glad I did!! This will make such a difference for my skin this Summer. You need this in your life if you have oily skin!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: WOW! This melts right into my skin and gives me beautiful light, even coverage. Keeps me matte through the day and even after a workout! This will be perfect for Summer. I’ve worn it by itself and over foundation, it’s amazing!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I wrote another review with pics and have since ordered #9 for depth. Someone in the reviews mentioned she recommended Rose and Ben’s C41 Blush Brush and my go to is now applying a layer with that brush, letting it dry down a little and then going back in with a second coat. It spreads beautifully with the brush (it’s dense but super soft and angled) and in areas where it might appear streaky I just tap a little. It works well as an eye primer too. I put it on there first and then let it dry down. It does cake into a line in the crease but I just tap that down with a dry finger and then move on to shadow and it does great.   I really wanted to see if I could travel with only this for foundation/primer/powder and the answer is yes!    I also wore a mask for a couple hours and sweated running errands in a mall that’s all glass which means it’s a million degrees inside when it’s sunny and it stood up to that heat. I actually laughed when I got home and looked in the mirror and it was still flawless.   Everything isn’t going to work for everybody but I hope you’re one of the lucky ones it works for!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted so badly to love this. But it’s…not good. I tried it with a brush, with a sponge, with my fingers. With a heavy moisturizer, with no product underneath, with sunscreen. Absolutely nothing made it work well for me. When I used my fingers it felt like rubbing sand on my skin. God forbid I use it under my eyes. Also it smells like gasoline or something. I use a whole spectrum of base products- from Ilia skin tint to Fenty powder foundation- and can make them all work for me, but I haven’t been able to get this one to do anything for me.

reviews.review_title: great for primer, but it has a learning curve
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really love this product but there is a learning curve in how to use it properly. I only use it for the oily zones of my face and avoid the areas where I know I am dry because otherwise this is just awful on them. As a primer on oily zones though, it works great and it enhances the durability of my makeup by 1000%. My skin also looks more airbrushed and I really enjoyed it. I wished it could work for every part of my face but I still think it’s a good product.

reviews.review_title: Good w/ powder foundation, smells like a car wash
reviews.review_buyer_description: fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: It smells a little funny in an not-perfumed way.  It smells chemically?  But not the ew-gross-melted-plastic-or-rubber way that the Milk Hydrogrip primer smells to me.  This actually makes me think of the car wash, maybe like the wipes they sometimes give you for your steering wheel/console?  Definite evokes some sort of car wash essence or perhaps new car smell?  It's very blurring.  I got it to use as a primer for powder foundations hoping it'd be something to create a bit of a barrier between the powder and my skin since it claims to maintain hydration (someone once told me I had the driest skin they'd ever seen) plus add a little extra coverage since I consider powder foundation to be my light coverage foundation.  I can't say my skin feels less dry than normal, but I wore this today combined with BareMinerals original loose powder foundation and my mom asked me what foundation I was wearing because it looked so blurred and light.  I like it.  It's easy to put on with my fingers (my preferred base application method) and works well with my powder foundations.  I've also worn it on its own just to add a little something something to my face and that worked well.  I haven't tried it with my normal liquid foundation (Estee Lauder Double Wear), so I can't report back on that.  It works with the Estee Lauder pressed powder foundation though, so I expect it'd be fine with the liquid.  My only complaint is that the car wash smell is a bit unusual but I only get a whiff of that if I intentionally smell the pan, and it's not off-putting to me like the Milk Hydrogrip primer smell.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: For every youtuber that said this was good: I hate you. This...is...a...gimmick. I can feel the powder granules in it just by rubbing it between my fingers. If you layer it, it needs powdering..there is no coverage unless  you build it up...At this point, I've spent about 400 bucks on Danessa's products and I just feel like she going down the Colour Pop rabbit hole of just throwing out stuff every few weeks. This is not a primer. It's not a foundation. Its a light cream powder that looks cute when setting with more powder. Do I need this? No. So the two shades I purchased are going back.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: LOVE this product!!! I put this on right after primer and it keeps my makeup looking so nice and prevents oiliness! I will be rebuying this over and over!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: If I could give this product zero stars I would. Don’t know if heat caused this product to turn into an oily, greasy mess but that’s what I got. Tried using it on my face and it was like I had slathered my face in Crisco. No matte, blurring finish here. Back this goes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This stuff is definitely unique! I bought it with the intention of using it as a foundation that would help with oil control during the day. It definitely helps with oil control - I use shade 3 all over and then use shade 1 to brighten and shade 8 to bronze. It is a seamless application when using a sponge. A brush caused some streaks that was hard to blend out. The shades are forgiving and I like that it can be used as a base, skin tint/foundation, or to set your face. Try it!

reviews.review_title: I'm sensitive to this near perfect product
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to love this product so much. I chose shade 5 and it was a match for my Mac NC42 complexion. true to its promises, it smoothed, blurred, had a beautiful even matte finish, controlled my oils, gripped my foundation, enhanced coverage of my more sheer founations, increased wear time. it looks fabulous worn alone and plays well with all my other makeup. but for three days, whenever I removed it at night my face  showed signs of irritation. I gained fine lines and wrinkles, barrier irritation like tiny bumps, and some clogged pores. im simply sensitive to the ingredients and alas, I cannot wear this. I recommend if your not Allergic or sensitive.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This oily skin girl just found a new best friend! I did a wear test on this baby. Literally blends so well, dries to a powder finish, helped cover my pores and acne, and stayed put 8 hours! I barely got oily at the end ( which is huge for me)!! Danessa seriously is so amazing and makes some of the BESt makeup! This was comfortable the entire day and felt like nothing on my skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: really cool multi use product. i’ve used it as a blurring primer (decent), undereye powder (not my fav), and face powder (amazing!! base lasts all day!) use a dense, synthetic brush (rose&ben c41) and really tap/press into skin. i have dry skin, but this leaves a flattering matte finish, a little drying but not bad. potential as an undereye primer? shadow primer?

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is my second time trying to write a review for this product. I am glad it worked out this way because I have has more time to use and reflect on the product. I really like this balm for oil control. I have extremely oily skin and this product really does a good job at absorbing the oil and it really works all day. Another thing I like about it is that I feel like it has improved my skin. I am experiencing less cystic acne. On an evening I forgot to remove my makeup my 3 cystic acne blemishes reduced which reall impressed me. I have to take a star away because i find that the make up gets splotchy around my nose and in between my eyebrows. I don't know how to prevent this from happening as I have not experienced this with a makeup before. Mayve using a smaller dense brush in those areas with help. I wonder if I anyone else has experienced this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have dry skin but an oily tone and when I say this controls your oils like no other I mean it. which is why I give it four stars bc it lives up to its claims. however I took off a star bc the the shade range is majority warm undertone. hardly any neutrals or cool tones. and I don't think this is good for those with dry skin. it starts off super pretty but at the end of the day it just sucked all the moisture out. of the dry parts of my face,sank into every pore and made my face look overly textured. no matter how much I prepped my skin different ways for 5 days. to my oily skin people you will LOVE this...

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The color match is perfect for me. It’s like magic how it looks and feels like a cream but applies on like a powder but doesn’t feel like a powder . My makeup didn’t move all night . I really love it , it’s a must have

reviews.review_title: There’s a learning curve to using this
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I didn’t like this at first and found it accentuates fine lines around the eyes and collects in dry spots around the nose (I have combination dry skin) when applied with no primer with a brush (I used the Rose and Ben C41 like Danessa uses in her videos) but once I switched to using Bobby Brown face base first, and letting that dry down for a full 10 mins before applying with my fingers, it’s BEAUTIFUL. It gives just enough coverage whilst still looking like skin, and I found it did blur out the larger pores on my nose and cheeks. I tried applying this over my under eye concealer (Armani luminous silk) and it didn’t lift the concealer and set it beautifully without settling into fine lines when applied with fingers. There’s a learning curve to using this (hence the 4 stars instead of 5) and it didn’t work as a primer for me, but since switching up how I use it, it has now become my day to day base product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Lovvvvve this. There is a learning curve. I personally apply it with my hands. I’ve worn it up to 16 hours and it does a great job at controlling oil production. Gives a light/medium coverage with one layer. Honestly very impressed. You only need a little product too so it will last a very long time. The color match is spot on if you have fair/light skin will yellow undertones!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This product definitely has a blurring effect. I could not get past the terrible chemical smell.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to love this SO badly.  It was AWFUL. It highlighted pores, texture, fine lines, there was NO blurring. It made my skin look TERRIBLE.  I have oily skin and was SO excited for something that would keep the oil down like it promised. It did NOT work for me. It never sat. Felt heavy and weird on my skin and separated.  I prepped well. Used primer. No primer. Different brushes. Fingers. I tried EVERYTHING.  I think if you are oily or have textured skin or pores this will not work.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to love this foundation as I have seen so many great reviews for it. Maybe it just didn’t work for me; maybe the hype was overrated. I tried it with a brush and it looked patchy. The next time I tried it with my fingers and it still turned patchy. The foundation does dry down to a powder finish, but the patchiness threw me off. Also, the color 1 is way too light, and there is no in between that will color match for fair to light skin. I will be returning..

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this on a whim cause I wanted to try something new but I was pleasantly surprised. It really does mattify and provides medium coverage. This will live in my bag for those days when I need a refresh/am overly dewy. Not sure what sorcery this is but I love it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: A fantastic foundation for oily skin! This balm has a small learning curve. Press the balm on, do not swish as it can cause streaking when the product is at its most emollient. It looks natural and looks just as good at the end of the day as it does in the beginning.

reviews.review_title: I don’t even get it but it’s magic!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It’s magic. It’s so weird. I don’t know what else to say. I’m going to try it as a primer but I put this on super oily spots and my t-zone after finishing my makeup and, y’all, it works. I had zero doubts this would be a waste of money. Nope.

reviews.review_title: For that no make-up make-up look
reviews.review_buyer_description: Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I don‘t know were to start. Well first of all it‘s magic.
