This is genius for guys that know nothing about make-up but want to hide imperfections on the skin because it‘s so easy to use. I love how it holds that oil on my face without breaking through. It‘s giving me a perfect matte finish without being flaky on some dry parts of my face.  No filter no retouch on the photo, just my skin using yummy blurring balm powder in shade 3 and shade 6 to shape and bronze.

reviews.review_title: I don't think others are using this correctly.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this just for the hype and was shocked with how beautiful it worked. I'm 38 with dry skin. I first used it as a primer after moisturizing, noticed right away that you can't use it with a brush because it will not give an even blend, tried with a beauty blender and while it blended, it soaked up too much product and finally realized that the best and only way to use this product is with ur fingers. The spoon is pretty but useless as the only way it worked for me was having it warm up by picking up the product with my finger.  I primed with it and was immediately impressed with how much it filled in pores, evened out skin tone and blurred my skin. I went on to use a light layer of Pat McGrath foundation (my normal daily foundation) with a beauty blender, still looked beautiful and more radiant than normal. I next used a tart concealer because I knew it would crease and I wanted to see if this would help a little and it did. I went over the concealer with this product first tapping it to get an even coverage and after using a beauty blender and I'm telling you that it made my concealer last all day, I even cried a little with my mother's day gifts from the kids and it still didn't budge. I was shocked that I could take a little on my finger and apply on top of my foundation, I just always used a beauty blender after to finish the job.  I would argue against the claims that it can be used as a foundation, I'm not sure about that but I have used it as a setting/finishing powder and as a primer and I'm just shocked with the beautiful results. The feeling and finish on its own is more like as if you used a primer and then a powder. I also can not express enough that no application worked for me outside of using my fingers first to warm it. For all those having issues with it, play around with it a little before throwing in the towel because I have dry skin and it gave me a radiant finish all day long.  I think this product is a serious game changer!

reviews.review_title: Great Product !! Gives full matte coverage !!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I ordered #7.  I wear NC47 in MAC's Studio Tech Cream to Powder.  I wore the Balm under my foundation and it gives you a flawless matte look.  The first time that I wore it I used a primer and powder over my foundation and it was TOOOOO matte.  When you use the Yummy Skin Blurring Balm Powder I don't think you need another primer or finishing powder.  I LOVE this product.  I also bought the Universal one but I haven't worn it yet.  Don't be fooled that it is dewey when you first put it on.  I don't think a person with very dry skin would like this,  That's just my opinion.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: So I got shade 2 and returned because it was just a very weird color. Decided to try the universal. I Am the OILEST PERSON ALIVE. I didn’t touch up my makeup for SEVEN hours. This is a miracle literally. You do have to be careful and selective with which foundation and how much you apply because it makes very sheer foundation look full coverage and kind of dry. To get this kind of oil control, I’ll take it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The blurring balm looks beautiful on! I use #6 over top of Rose Inc. 80 and my skin looks amazing - glowy without the shine, and also soft and smooth, blurring any imperfections on my skin like hyperpigmentation. It doesn't feel heavy at all. I also use it alone on my forehead to dull that afternoon shine that comes along with combination skin iykyk. I'm going to pick up the universal shade too, I think it will be nice for summer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: OMG! I love this product. Goes on smoothly and completely blurs my pores. I loved it so much I bought the universal as well. Sephora please put this in the stores—it shouldn’t just be online.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Wow I am really impressed. Just testing it out now. Btw I did not get this product for free, I ordered it online and it just arrived :) I think this is my first Danessa Myricks but I have definitely scoped the products out before. But yea I am really happy with my first try, the formula of it is really nice and smooth. It did not sit in my pores which I was worried about, it’s definitely blurring and my bf literally wants me to use it on him to cover up a spot tomorrow night lol because he watched how I put it on (patting with my fingers) and it disappeared, fully covering all redness around my nose and chin area.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Now I get greasy easily, and it’s very hard to find a “foundation “ that does the job.. I did really love how I had to use a little product for it to cover.. It did hold up very well and it did control my oil. The only reason I did 4 star is because Around my nose area it was clumping and separating.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got shade 4 thinking this would be a great summer color for me. With the Upsalite I figured it will really help control shine during humid summer months, but I’m normally balanced to dry. So it feels just lovely going on, like you would imagine a silky balm to feel, then it has a powder finish. It’s not patchy and didn’t settle into any areas at all. It has a very light fragrance, it’s kind of minty smelling but I don’t notice it unless I shove my nose into the balm, certainly didn’t notice it while applying or once it’s on. I swatched shade 4 on my cheek in the picture then blended it in. This is a huge hit for me and I’m so glad I purchased!

reviews.review_title: Oily skin tested and sort of approved?
reviews.review_buyer_description: Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Danessa really sold me on this product during one of her IG live videos. I have oily skin and prefer a light weight formula that I can quickly apply. Im struggle with how to use this product and have tried it multiple ways (primer, foundation, concealer, setting). So far the lightest layer as a foundation has worked but due to a shade issue, it might be better as a primer until I can get a darker shade. I do not like this under the eyes so definitely avoid as a concealer! Also, I’ve tried using brushes, my fingers and a sponge to apply and so far the sponge works the best for me. This is a product that needs to be really pushed into the skin but be careful because it does have quite a bit of pigment! Here’s the pros and cons:  Pros- definitely mattifying! This 100% helps me control my oils which is a struggle I constantly have with makeup products. Also, less is more with this product so you do not need much how ever you use it!   Cons: Too powdery of a finish and that is coming from someone who prefers a powder foundation to a liquid or cream. This leaves my skin looking more dry and textured at the beginning (even after my serum, moisturizer, sunscreen and auric glow lust primer). It does eventually “warm” up and look more natural but I prefer my initial application to look flawless. Lastly, I’ve noticed this color range runs lighter than the swatches show. I’m light with cool undertones so I’m recommended shade 1. Shade 1 is unfortunately too light and Shade 2 is too yellow. Im going to make shade 1 work but will definitely be looking at Shade 3 when it is inside Sephora.

reviews.review_title: Does not live up to the hype.
reviews.review_buyer_description: brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have balanced to dry skin. Does not live up the hype as others have stated! . I made sure to prep my skin and be moisturized, (as I feared this would be drying). Was very blotchy even with using a brush and blending very well. I used this alone to see how it would perform. Through out the day only continued to dry my skin more and more. I could see every pore and wrinkle and only got worse as the hours went by. Also, the color is not forgiving. It looked to orange/dark in me. I followed every “tip and direction”for application.

reviews.review_title: Spend time finding the best fit for you!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I repeat: You must spend time with this product to find its best fit for you!!!!  My t-zone generates enough oil to moisturize a small village so when I heard what was promised from this balm I was way more hopeful than skeptical and it did not disappoint!   Day 1 I applied it over my serum and moisturizer using my fingers, then used a brush to even it out. First it was simply balmy. By the time I did my eyes and brows it was actually TOO matte. By the time I was fully dressed it had settled into close to perfection and STAYED THAT WAY! All day! I did the slightest blot in the evening and that’s only because I like matte matte. It blurred and matted aaaaallday! That said the consistency it dried down to was a bit odd.   So day 2 I’m trying it as a primer under Dior’s backstage foundation and it’s beautiful! This might just be the perfect perfect I was looking for. I think the difference is that light reflects off the foundation combo in a more natural way than it does off the balm. I also used it as an eye primer today (I consider this part of my t-zone) and so far so good! It’s been a few hours and I would normally have creasing by now. Oh I have wild pores. The only way they’d ever be fully blurred is if I got a new nose. That said with foundation worked better than without pore wise.   Tomorrow I will try it on top of YSL’s bare look tint which I usually wear as a tinted moisturizer with powder on top.

reviews.review_title: doesn’t live up to its claims
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was hoping to replace my tinted moisturizer with this for the warmer and humid months. I heard that the shades stretch far, and it can provide sheer but buildable coverage for an even complexion. It sure does even out my skin, but the nothing else holds in my opinion.   Texture: Someone below said it best, it feels like it’s gonna self-set, but it somehow remains slippery. It looks matte upon application, but it also doesn’t feel like powder and I got greasy within the hour, which isn’t normal for me. I have a combination skin, I exfoliated & moisturized ahead of time. I applied w/ a foundation brush but It not only didn’t blur my skin, but also accentuated my pores and texture somehow.   Color: I got 3, and it looks VERY cool toned on my warm olive skin. I’m quite pale now, so I expected this to be slightly darker / warmer on me, but It actually applied brighter than in the pan, so much so that my face just looked pale, grayish pink at the end. I tried to warm it up w/ bronzer and blush, which is problematic because I’d have to bronze my entire face to cover up the ill-matching tone. I’m surprised this “neutral” shade is looking so pink on me so I don’t think the next shade darker will fix this issue for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Decided to try this product, but ultimately quite disappointed. I never use primer, because it tends to settle in my pores and make them super visible, like lighter than my skin. This product did the same thing worse than any other primer I’ve ever used. The texture is strange, which makes me not want to use it over another foundation, which is the only other use I can foresee for this product. Total waste of money.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I was super excited to try this and the name just made it sound buttery and like something that just blended into your skin beautifully but that is definitely not the case. It didn’t blend in AT ALL. I properly washed and exfoliated, used a light moisturizer and primer as I always do and this is how it came out (see picture). It just sits in the skin looking blotchy and seperated. I am returning for sure.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This balm is amazing!!! I have the oiliest skin in the world but I was able to wear this translucent balm under my Laura Mercier tinted moisturizer and I did NOT blot for over 8 hours! If you’re oily you know that’s amazing and RARE!

reviews.review_title: Just Buy it Already, you know you want to
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this stuff I used my normal tatcha primer then applied it like I would a foundation then added bronzer and blush and it was good to go. It didn’t blur all of my pores but it did do a great job considering I have big pores and acne scars from years ago. I will definitely repurchase when I run out

reviews.review_title: Don’t need anything else !  A true review!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Everyone is confused about what kind of product this is ! It’s a foundation in a cream to powder form that blurs and covers imperfections! Reminds me of KVD apple foundation but better it’s lighter weight and improves the look of your ski and doesn’t smudge off , no more liquid foundation for me !

reviews.review_title: Multi-use and so easy to apply
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Kind of like the makeup tip where you apply powder before foundation, this does that for me. I don't even feel it on my skin, it's so light as if it's a part of my skincare. I think this will replace my blotting powders because it does such a good job at giving me a natural matte look while blurring my pores. Under foundation, it's like i don't even need to use a setting powder. I also tried it as an eye primer and i really works/ keeps my oily lids from creasing. Danessa is a genius and will be my HG product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Holy mother of God. I am knocking on 40 and had high hopes for this. It did not disappoint. Granted, I've only had it on three hours but I'm in love. I used it as a primer for my foundation (wet n wild dewy, believe it or not), and I swear it took ten years off. Just to add this, I live in Georgia where it is very hot and humid and I have never had any luck with primer. I will update tonight on the longevity but so far it's absolutely amazing.

reviews.review_title: Perplexed... feels like a complicated olive.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Was really looking forward to this launch. Sounded innovative, borderline too good to be true but as we are all always looking for the best skin perfecting product, everything is worth a shot.  I have to admit that I'm confused about this product. I went in with the expectation that something that claims to be a primer, foundation, and powder might not be able to execute all of those claims flawlessly, but I can't help but feel that it doesn't really live up to any of the claims in a way that is effective? When worn alone, both the universal shade and the tinted shade seem greasy upon application, and dries to a powdery finish, but in the strangest way. Somehow reminds me of a cross between an Elf Putty Primer, Benefit Porefessional, and the original silicone Smashbox primer. It sets down in a sense, but still remains flexible, and I'm not sure if it's in a good way - it's like slippery powder? In the way that Silly Putty or that kinetic sand stuff aren't really solid and aren't really liquid. In the way that olives are sour and oily and meaty and juicy and dry and salty and sweet and sour all at the same time. It's too many things all at once.   Coverage is flexible, can be easily sheered out or built up. But on the skin, it floats on top, and somehow blurs in an unflattering way?  As a finishing powder or setting powder, it controls shine in the way a mattifying putty primer would, it dries down but remains slippy at the same time.  Not sure if I'm the problem here, or if this product is just too good to be true.  User error? Perhaps. Very innovative product? Definitely. Baffling? Perplexing? Confusing? Absolutely. Working for me? Not so much.  Extra points for being new and exciting, but I can't help but feel let down. This is like a first date with a handsome man that is rude to the serving staff... looks good in theory, but it's never going to work.

reviews.review_title: Looks like skin! A filter in a pan!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Definitely blurring! It's basically a tinted primer and has a finish like a finishing powder. Extremely lightweight and not at all silicone like when i used a dense brush (NYX 37 buffing brush). I love wearing this alone and it covers my redness. It looks so natural, not cakey. By the time i wanted to touch up, i'm oily and hate a dewy nose, the wear down is graceful..Not patchy or splotchy. I would suggest that you regularly exfoliate because it did catch on a dry pimple lol.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: My face is mix to oily and this product really last me the whole day without need to re-touch.  I also used it as an eye primer and my eye shadows looked great all day as well.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I just goth we in the mail today and couldn’t wait to try her out. Ok I was scared to try this product because Balms + Oily skin don’t go together. I am pleasantly surprised! Yes, this definitely feels like a balm but don’t let that scare you. It applies like a balm but dries down to a powder. I have no idea how that happens but it does. It was hard for me to pick a shade based on the example pictures on the site, and upon arrival it looks too dark but is my exact shade. I have not worn it long enough for a full wear test but first impressions are positive. The texture dries down (for lack of better words because “dry down” doesn’t adequately explain what happens) to a smooth finish that I would describe as light but buildable. I was able to get a medium coverage. This is the first time in a long time I’ve been excited about a complexion product and I recommend it to anyone who’s thinking about buying it

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This blurring powder is now always with me in my bag. So light feels on skin, so easy to apply even with fingers . Has light coverage, looks Demi Matt , skin after all day do not have shine . I have sensitive, skin, light ton , from serum foundation my shade is N4.
